All CCT community clients, including Neslie, are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages which she needs in her business to increase profit.

loans.name: Ganriu Group

texts.en:
Kholboi is a mother of three children. She is very simple yet creative when it comes to weaving. She is the profiled borrower of the group pictured with her hand raised with the group members. They live in Namching village, which is very far from the main town. Her husband is a daily wage earner and can earn up to 300 INR in good health. 

His income was hardly sufficient to meet their family's needs, so Kholboi took the initiative to start her own business and availed herself of a loan from WSDS in 2013 that was invested in weaving. She has skills in weaving since a young age. She designs and weaves beautiful shawls for selling purposes. She also hires two people as helpers and pays them to increase her production, which has been very helpful in her business. The loan helped the family so much, and they are able to pay their fees regularly now, including the children's education fees. She also repaid her loan regularly without any delay. 

She now aspires to buy one hand loom and employ one more person in her business. With the Kiva loan, she will buy a hand loom and employ one person. She will also buy silk yarn for weaving beautiful shawls. She will also pay her employee monthly as remuneration. The money she gets from her weaving business will be saved up to buy a sofa set for her family. They will be able to sit and relax on the sofa and will spend family time comfortably. 

She is very happy and excited for the loan and hopes to make maximum utilization of the loan. She says thank you, Kiva. 

The entire group members are engaged in different business including poultry, vegetable vending, piggeries and weaving for sustenance. They are all very happy to avail themselves of the loan from WSDS. They thank all the generous lenders for their benevolent act.

loans.use: to buy a hand loom to employ one person in her weaving business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is a married woman with four children who works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fruit and vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income  raising livestock. Angelina requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

Angelina has sustained her business activities through 6 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Nano

texts.en:
This is the story of Nano:

"My name is Nano. Now I'm continuing education at the Academy Maritime of the Nusantara (AMN), and the courses I'm taking are Engineering, Ship Engineering. I come from a village suburb of Java, precisely in the hamlet of Panikel, in Kampung Laut. My hometown, like other hamlets, is very quiet with very few jobs in the village. 
My father is predominantly a farmer, but just an ordinary farmer. Income is uncertain due to extreme weather conditions. I am the second of two brothers, and my sister works as a laborer. My parents are now very old, so they have reduced energy for work. 
Due to my parents' lack of money, I would like a Kiva loan. Hopefully with this loan, I can finish school at the Academy Maritime Nusantara, in the town of Cilacap, and then I can ease the burden of my parents' living costs. My parents are very happy about this loan. I hope I can repay the loan after I finish school and find work. 
We are very grateful to the lenders who are helping us, although we do not know you personally. "

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
Maa Tarini Self Help Group (SHG) was formed in Sept. 2014 and consists of 13 rural poor women members who live below the poverty line. This group is located in a rural hamlet named Jharsaram of the village Kushmal of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. 

Sunita is one of the members of this group. The lady standing second from right with a raised hand is Sunita. She is a very active and young lady of 32 years of age. She lives with her husband and two children.

The main source of income of Sunita is vegetable cultivation. She, along with her husband, manages a cultivation farm, where she grows vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, carrots, cabbages, chiles, cucumbers, papaya, ladies finger, onions and maize. She sells her products to the traders of the nearest town, who come to take vegetables from her farm. 

Sunita earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR from her business. According to her, this scanty income is not at all sufficient to meet the day to day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses. So Sunita wants to expand her cultivation by adding some advance techniques of farming by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. She has planned to utilize the present loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs like good quality seeds, manure, and pesticides for her farm. She is also planning to purchase a diesel water lifting pump for smooth water supply. She has also planned to take the help of the local agriculture and horticulture departments for crop planning with different schemes and programs meant for farmers. 

She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. Sunita dreams to construct a farm house. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work. 

The other 12 members of this group are also doing vegetable cultivation, a milk business, black gram and green gram cultivation, goat rearing, etc.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing fertilizer and farm inputs like good quality seeds, manure,  pesticides and a diesel water pump for her farm.

loans.name: Liegh

texts.en:
Liegh is enthusiastic about farming. She grows rice in Liloy and has good earnings doing this type of work. 

She recently applied for a loan to pay for land preparation. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Liegh knew that she has to get things right to increase her income for this growing season. 

In the future, Liegh hopes to buy a truck to easily transport her produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation.

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda has been a vegetable and fruit vendor for 3 years. 

She is 46 years old, married, and has two children. Renilda lives with her family in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. 

Renilda needs a loan to buy condiments, vegetables, and fruit to sell. She will use the loan to improve her stock and attract more buyers to her store. 

In the future, Renilda hopes to make her business sustainable and profitable. She wants to save money to reinvest in her business and pay for  her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora, 57, is married with five adult-age children. 

Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years. The business helped meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. 

Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be well served and has applied for a loan for this purpose. She is still planning a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. In the past, she has borrowed to purchase additional stock and now she is re-applying for a new loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 42-year-old  married woman who  lives in Lao Proper, Plaridel.

Nida has had a fish vending business and  market stall for 4 years and pays monthly rent. Nida earns a meager income and finds that it is difficult to  meet the family needs, especially her children's education. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Nida has recently became an active member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase additional  fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery items, toiletries, and beverages she needs to expand her store.

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Jema is a mother from Plaridel, Misamis Occidental who never tires of  supporting her family.  She is no longer a babysitter and laundrywoman, working for a daily wage.

She started snack vending business, which is doing well.  She spends time perfecting her own food snack recipes. She has maximized her profits and pursues her goals for the good of her family. She requests a loan from PMPC to buy  ingredients to prepare more snacks, to attract more customers, and able to accept new orders. 

She hopes and prays that her business would grow and new snack recipes would increase sales. Jema is able to help others to earn an income for their own family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare more snacks.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
María es una joven mujer de 19 años de nacionalidad ecuatoriana, es madre soltera y su hijo tiene apenas 6 meses de nacido, el es su motor de vida y por quien lucha todos los días, ha vivido con su madre durante 7 años en un barrio rural de la ciudad de Latacunga llamado Santa Rosa de Pichul característico por tener gente trabajadora y honesta. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de empanadas de pollo y carne, su producto es muy solicitado sin embargo no posee un coche para mejor comodidad de ella y de sus clientes es por esto que solicita su crédito.  
María agradece a FUNDACION ALTERNATIVA y a KIVA por hacer posible cumplir uno de sus sueños y mejorar su ámbito laboral.
texts.en:
María, 19, is a young Ecuadorian woman.  She's the single mother of a child who is just six months old.  He's her motivation in life, and she strives for him every day.  She has lived with her mother for seven years in the city of Latacunga, in Santa Rosa de Pichul, a rural neighborhood known for hardworking and honest people.

She earns a living making and selling chicken and meat empanadas, which are in high demand.  She doesn't have a car, however, for her greater convenience and that of her customers, so she's requesting a loan.

María's grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for making it possible to achieve one of her dreams and improve her working conditions.

loans.use: to buy a car so she can reach more customers with her food and prosper for the benefit of her baby

loans.name: Pedro Manuel

texts.es:
Pedro es todo un veterano del campo, este aguerrido granjero desde el año 1984 inicio con su empresa de agricultura buscando poder generar los recursos suficientes para alimentar a sus 5 hijos, hoy en día todos ellos mayores de edad.
Este negocio lo inicio gracias a que un amigo muchos años atrás lo motivo y le enseño todo sobre el campo.
En su empresa emplea una persona y es tanta la preocupación por ella que hoy viene a solicitar un crédito para dos cosas una pagar los jornales de este empleado y dos compras de insumos precisamente abono para nuevos cultivos.
Con este crédito cubrirá la responsabilidad de pagar a su empleado lo que corresponde y le permitirá abonar sus nuevos cultivos.
Su sueño es tener salud y trabajar para llevar al mercado productos frescos y de calidad para el consumo humano.
texts.en:
Pedro is a complete veteran of the fields.  He's a seasoned farm worker who's been in it since 1984.  He started his agriculture business while seeking to generate enough income to feed his five children, who are now grown.  

He started the business many years ago thanks to a friend who motivated him and taught him all about the land.  The business employs one person, whom Pedro is so concerned with that he has come to seek a loan for two reasons:  one, to pay the employee's wages; and two, to buy supplies, in particular fertilizer for his new crops.

With the loan, Pedro will uphold his responsibility to pay his employee and he'll be able to fertilize the new crops.  His dream is to be healthy and to work to bring to market fresh products that are fit for people to eat.

loans.use: to pay employee wages and to buy fertilizer for his new crops.

loans.name: Savin

texts.en: Savin is a 47-year-old married grocer and a mother with three children in her care. She lives in Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. So far Savin has been in her business for nearly three years. Among the children, the oldest is a garment-factory worker and two others attend school. Her husband is 42 years old and he is a bus driver at a company. For their income, all of them can make approximately $19.66 per day. In order to improve her family’s lifestyle, Savin would like to request a loan to buy a cow to breed for calves to sell.  This loan will help her earn more income to support the family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business, build a bigger house and help her children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy a cow to breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Lecerio

texts.en:
Lecerio is a 58-year-old married man and a father of three grown-up children from Concepcion, Iloilo. He runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in his place. This is the source of his income for the past 30 years now.
 
Lecerio is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and chips, soft drinks, sugar and coffee, soap and detergents, toiletries and condiments. This loan will help him improve his stock, thus allowing him to sell more to his customers. In the future, Lecerio hopes to make his business productive and stable.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and chips, soft drinks, sugar and coffee, soap and detergents, toiletries and condiments

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a fisherman. They live in Plaridel-Danao, Philippines. Remedios supports the daily needs of the family by selling the catch of her husband and by buying the catch of her neighbors to sell. In January of 2014,  Remedios applied for membership in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) after she learned of the benefits offered by the Co-op to its members. She became a member in good standing and has received several loans, which were repaid in a timely manner. She is a persevering mother who wants nothing more but to see all her children achieve their diplomas and have stable jobs. Remedios is in need of financial assistance. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay for her children's school expenses this school year. Someday, she hopes to build a concrete house for the family.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school expenses this school year

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen  is a businesswoman who earns an income selling various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks to renovate her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is a 45-year old married man with a 1 and 6 year old, from Iloilo, Philippines. 

Elmer has been in fishing and motorcycle rental for 20 years. This provide the income that he needs for his family. He asks for 25,000 PHP to buy hooks, fishing nets, a boat propeller, an engine, and fishing weights.

Elmer dreams of having a stable business with enough income for his family. As a father, he is determined to do everything so his children can have a good education.

loans.use: to buy hooks, fishing nets, a boat propeller, an engine, and fishing weights.

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edison is a father of two who earns a living operating a farm to grown rice. He had been in this business for many years and he earns enough for his family.  He requests a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides to have an abundant harvest. 

He plans to expand the farm by planting another plot in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Evangline

texts.en:
Hog-fattening is the business of Evangline, who lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 61 years old, married, with three children. She has been in the business for many years, in which she generates income to support her family. 

With this loan, Evangline will borrow money amounting to PHP 12,000. This will help her a lot, especially in boosting her income!

loans.use: to buy bags of feed and vitamins for the growing hogs.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, noodles, etc. for her food-vending business.

Jessie earns more income from pig fattening.

Jessie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, vegetables, noodles, etc. for her business

loans.name: Arlin

texts.en:
Arlin is a 44-year-old married woman with four children, two attend school.

Arlin has raised livestock for 3 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business.

She has previously borrowed and successfully repaid 5 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Arlin would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Mohirakhon

texts.en:
Mohirakhon is a 38-yeard old  mother of two daughters who are 12 and 18 years old. Her younger daughter goes to school and the elder is a student.   Mohirakhon lives with her family in the center of Khujand city.

Mohirakhon's husband works at the service station. 

 Mohirakhon and her husband do not have the money to pay for their daughter's tuition, who is studying at the Institute of Economy and Trade. They need a loan of 1,500 USD. 

Mohirahon has faith in the Kiva lenders to help her daughter  continue her studies at the institute.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 29 years old and a single man. Even though he is single he works hard to help his parents earn a living. He has been catching crabs for 10 years now. Crabs are very easy to sell and are in high demand in the restaurants of Iloilo. He is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing nets and crab traps and to pay for the labor of those who will be helping him in his business. His income will pay for food and the household bills of his parents and himself.

Francis wishes to expand his business in the future so he can save enough to accomplish his dreams in life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and crab traps and to pay for labor

loans.name: Arlin

texts.en:
Arlin is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Arlin has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Arlin has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Jaime Alberto

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre dedicado a su familia y a su labor. Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le presentan. 

Desde hace 4 años inició su propio negocio, una barbería que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside. 

Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su hijo de 10 años con su educación. 

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra insumos como una maquina nueva, cuchillas, gel, entre otros, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Jaime manifiesta que su mayor sueño es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitivo en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Impacta la vida de Jaime con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Jaime is dedicated to his work and his family. His tenacity and perseverance have allowed him to get ahead, overcoming the various obstacles that have presented themselves. 

Four years ago, he started his own business, a barbershop located in his home. This has allowed him to generate the necessary resources to support the education of his 10-year-old son. 

The loan that he requests will be used to purchase supplies such as new clippers, razors, gel, and more. This will allow him to continue his work and to offer a more complete service to his customers, in a more efficient and flexible manner, thereby increasing the profit margins generated by his work. 

Jaime states that his greatest dream is to be able to continue his work and to establish and strengthen his business to be more competitive in the market, and therefore have the ability to improve his family's quality of life.

Make an impact in Jaime's life with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy supplies such as new clippers, razors, gel, and more.

loans.name: Musarrat

texts.en:
Musarrat is a 49-year-old married woman with 4 children. She and her husband have sold glasses, plates, and bowls for many years. 

Her husband helps her to sell to the people of their community and local market. She  contributes to the family's income. She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to improve her business. She will be able to purchase  tea sets, soup sets, dinner sets, and platters in different sizes and designs. 

She expects an increase in earnings and wants to use part of her income to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tea sets, soup sets, dinner sets, and platters in different sizes and designs.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana, de 44 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas cerca a su casa ubicada en el municipio de Turbo, en este negocio vende pasteles de pollo, empanadas, buñuelos, entre otros alimentos típicos de la región.

Ana trabaja todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos.

Ella pide un aliento económico para comprar una nevera y para realizar adecuaciones locativas en su cocina.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus hijos.
texts.en:
44-year-old Ana has chosen to start a food business close her home, located in the Turbo municipality.  In this business she sells chicken pies, empanadas and fried dough, among other foods typical of the region.  

Ana works every day from 6:00 in the morning until 1:00 in the afternoon.  She is a responsible and sensible woman, and dedicated to her business.  Among her unfulfilled dreams is to be able to have a restaurant that offers distinct types of food and creates jobs.  

She asks for some economic encouragement to buy a refrigerator and to make interior adjustments to her kitchen.  The loan will have a favorable impact on her life and business, as she will be able to achieve her dream and have a greater variety of foods to offer her customers, as well as the fact that her children rely on this business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and make adjustments to her kitchen.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 29-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, and clothing. 

Alia has been doing a business of making artificial flowers for the past three years. She offers various handmade artificial flowers in different colors which are used for decorating homes in events like marriage ceremonies and birthday parties. By now, she has become well-known for providing good quality, colorful flowers in her community. 

Currently, Alia has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase raw materials, including tissue paper, shiny paper, glace paper, and packs of glue, paint, and wires. In this way, she will be able to inflate her earnings and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, including tissue paper, shiny paper, glace paper, and packs of glue, paint, and wires.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es una mujer de 46 años de edad, soltera, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural caracterizada por el comercio agrícola por mayor, cientos de productores de fruta, verdura y carne, llevan sus productos hasta el lugar para que sean comprados por comerciantes mayoristas para distribuirlos en ferias, mercados y supermercados. De clima templado durante todo el año.
Emiliana es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (pollera, manta y sombrero), su lengua materna es el Quechua que combina con español según la lengua del cliente. Su vida la realiza con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y viven una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; pique macho (papas fritas, con carne picada y ají) y lechón (carne de cerdo cocinada al horno), no tiene puesto de venta fijo vende de forma ambulante. su sueño es tener un restaurante donde pueda cocinar más comidas. Ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Emiliana solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, el baño y la lavandería para que sus hijos vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a single 46-year-old woman with two children, 12 and 8.  She has a business selling traditional meals.  She's a good mother, enterprising, responsible, and hardworking. She works in the town of Sacaba, a rural area known for its wholesale agriculture and hundreds of fruit, vegetable, and meat products.  She brings her products to where they are bought by wholesale merchants who distribute them to fairs, markets, and supermarkets.  Temperatures are mild year-round.  

Emiliana is brown-skinned, of small of stature, with long black braided hair.  Her dress is traditional (full gathered skirt, shawl, and bowler hat).  Her native language is Quechua, which she combines with Spanish, the language of her clientele.  She and her children, who study at school, live in her own house, which is made of brick and has electricity and well water.  She sells traditional meals like pique macho (french fries with chopped meat and peppers), and lechón (oven-roasted pork).  She doesn't have a fixed locale so she travels around.  Her dream is to have a restaurant where she can make more meals.

Emiliana wants to install a potable-water system in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room so her children can live better.  This is her first loan cycle with this institution in the seven years she's been in business and it's for the aforementioned reasons that she's seeking a loan.

loans.use: to add a potable-water system to her kitchen, bathroom and laundry room so her children can live better.

loans.name: Indumati

texts.en:
Indumati is 35 years old, a mother of two children. She lives in a small village of Cuttack district with her children and husband. She owns a small grocery shop in her house and her husband is a farmer who produces paddy rice and vegetables. 

Indumati is asking for a loan to build a latrine in her house to access clean and safe sanitation as currently her family members have to go outside for that purpose.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this great support.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 30-year-old woman, living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw which did not belong to him. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good, but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the rickshaw. He wants to start driving, but he is looking for a lump sum amount.

Therefore, Uzma has requested a loan for her husband, so he can fix his rickshaw and can happily drive it. Uzma hopes that her husband will now be able to generate a constant income.

Uzma is very happy after receiving this loan. She gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Tania Esther

texts.es:
Tania una madre cabeza de familia, luchadora, trabajadora, honesta y comprometida que gracias a su negocio de venta de productos de aseo tanto personal como para el hogar ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar que está conformado por ella y sus dos hijos de 11 y 6 años de edad.
Inicio su negocio como necesidad de generar ingresos hoy busca alternativas para poder mejorar sus condiciones, ventas, incrementar su utilidad, por ello confió en los asesores de interactuar quienes le hicieron un diagnóstico de la empresa y concluyeron que necesita un capital de trabajo para invertir en ciertas cosas.
Por tal razón Tania quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido en productos de aseo personal.
Con el crédito mejorara varias falencias que tiene en cuanto a mercancía pudiendo abarcar mayor clientela al tener los productos demandados.
texts.en:
Tania is a mother and head of the household, a fighter, a hard-worker, honest and dedicated.  Thanks to her business selling hygiene products for both personal and household use, she has been able to support her household, which is made up of herself and her two children, ages 11 and 6.  

She started her business out of a necessity to generate income.  Now she is seeking alternatives to be able to improve conditions and sales, and increase the utility of her business.  For this, she confided in the advisors at Interactuar, who did an analysis of her business and concluded that she needed the capital to invest in certain things.  For this reason, Tania is requesting a loan to buy the a stock of personal hygiene products.  With the loan, she will be able to improve many shortcomings related to merchandise and take on more clients by having products that are in-demand.

loans.use: to buy personal hygiene products and household cleaning products to improve her low sales.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is managing her eatery business in Sindangan, Philippines. She mastered the business when she and her husband were married. The business has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She also does catering for added income. She has applied for a loan to purchase more meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and has an idea to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and spices for her eatery business.

location.town: Sindangan - Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Lucelly

texts.es:
Lucelly, una mujer de 51 años de edad que ha dado toda su vida en beneficio de su familia intentando sacarla  adelante y superando juntos las adversidades que se les han presentado en la vida; gracias a una tienda que con mucho esfuerzo, paciencia y sacrificio logro montar, ha generado los ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus hijos. 

Buscando ser la mejor empresa familiar del sector quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido que le permitan aumentar su inventario como granos y abarrotes.
 
Este crédito será la gran oportunidad para consolidarse como la tienda más productiva en el barrio y le dará la oportunidad de cumplir ese sueño que tanto ha anhelado de comprar una vivienda propia.

Apoya a Lucelly con su negocio!
texts.en:
Lucelly, a 51-year-old woman, has dedicated her entire life to providing for her family and overcoming together the challenges that life has thrown at them. Thanks to a shop which she managed to open through much effort, patience and sacrifice, she has made enough money to take care of her children. 

Looking to become the best family-run business in the sector, she requests a loan to purchase stock to increase her inventory, such as bulk grains and groceries. This loan will be a great opportunity to solidify the store's position as the best in the neighborhood, and will give her the opportunity to accomplish the dream which she has always yearned for, to purchase her own house. 

Support Lucelly and her business!

loans.use: to purchase stock, such as bulk grains and groceries, which will allow her to increase her inventory

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu works in agriculture and raises goats. She has been involved in this business for more than six years. Bindu is 28 years old, and she is married and has two children. She lives and works in Angul district, a rural area in Odisha state.

This is Bindu's first loan with Peoples Forum. The main hardship that Bindu faces in her life is the lack of a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick, with which to build a toilet.

Bindu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her agricultural business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase materials with which to build a toilet for her family's use.

loans.name: Chitralekha

texts.en:
Chitralekha works in agriculture. She is 38 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Angul district, a rural area in Odisha state.

In 2014, Chitralekha joined Peoples Forum to improve her business and health through Peoples Forum loan products.

Chitralekha has been involved in her agriculture business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Chitralekha faces in her life is not having an hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Chitralekha hopes for her family to be healthy and happy. She is happy with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a toilet.

loans.name: Sasmita

texts.en:
Sasmita works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is 35 years old and married, with two children. Sasmita lives in Angul district, a rural town in Odisha state, India. She has been involved in the agriculture business for more than five years.

This is Sasmita's first loan with Peoples Forum. The main hardship that Sasmita faces in life is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick, to build a toilet.

Sasmita hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick, with which to build a toilet.

loans.name: Jahna

texts.en:
Jahna has a service business tailoring clothes. She is expert in ladies' dressmaking. She has been involved in this business for more than seven years.

Jahna is 45 years old and married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Angul district, a rural town in Odisha state.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Jahna is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet. This is her first loan with Peoples Forum.

In the future, Jahna hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nargas

texts.en: Nargas is a 58-year-old married woman. She is an artisan who does hand-made embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to build a clientele, which allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to buy spools of thread in different colors, as well as packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishing; this will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful that she will be able to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of her bright future, and hopes to someday build her own house.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors as well as beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Sandra Lee

texts.es: SANDRA LEE: Es una mujer amable y luchadora, originaria del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 48 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos: 3 mayores de edad y un menor de 19 años que cursa su primer año de carrera universitaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 15 años estableció su pequeña pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: granos básicos, gaseosas, chiverías, detergentes, jabón de lavar ropa, sopas instantáneas, papel higiénico, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Sandra Lee is a friendly and determined woman, originally from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. She is 48 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are grown and one, 19 years old, who is a first-year university student. With the goal of creating her own source of income, she started her own convenience store 15 years ago. 

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise: bulk grains, soda, snacks, instant soup, detergent, laundry soap, toilet paper, and more. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: the purchase merchandise: bulk grains, soda, snacks, instant soups, detergent, laundry soap, toilet paper, and more.

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is a 35-year-old woman from the community of Carles, in Iloilo province. She is married, with five children, ages three to twelve. 

Rena and her husband provide for their children through the income that they generate from fishing and catching crabs. 

Rena is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets since the old ones need to be replaced. Rena hopes that, through the loan, she can eventually enhance her business to be more profitable and sustainable.

The income generated will be used to pay for school and nutritious diet.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en: Khursheed is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices and raises them, then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to her family's income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. Khursheed needs to improve her business in order to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistani Rupees to purchase more animals in order to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat, cooking oil, vinegar, rice, soft drinks, salt, and other condiments.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita, a very hardworking entrepreneur from Payatas Quezon City, Philippines, is 49 years old and together with her husband, Adito, she manages their dried fish business. Her income is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

Elenita buys a variety of dried fish from her suppliers and then sells them on the streetside. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of PHP1,000 in sales everyday. She also sells frozen products which she can usually dispose of within a span of a few hours.

Elenita is requesting an PHP 11,000 loan to purchase more stocks of dried fish and frozen foods to sell. She will use her loan to increase her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Elenita hopes to expand soon. She also dreams that her children will complete their studies. 

Elenita meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each fellowship group, composed of 15 to 30 community partners, gathers each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy dried fish products and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Bronai Antonio

texts.es:
Bronay un agricultor alegre, que vive, siente el campo ya que este le ha dado todo, en el crecieron sus 5 hijos todos ellos menores de edad.
Bronay heredo su negocio de su familia, aprendió con ellos todo lo relacionado con el campo y ha sabido mejorar su producción de plantación de plátano.
Bronay quiere solicitar un crédito para la preparación de tierra como abonos y riegos y unas adecuaciones para preparar sus cultivos para los repentinos cambios de clima, sequias y aguaceros tan inesperados que se están dando.
texts.en:
Bronay is a cheerful farmer for whom the fields are a part of his heart and soul, for they have given him everything. His five minor children grew up on them. He inherited his business from his family and learned everything pertaining to farm work from them. 

He has managed to improve his plantain production. Bronay wants to request a loan to prepare the land. He will buy fertilizer, irrigation supplies, and other items he needs in order for his crops to be prepared for any sudden changes in weather, droughts, and the unexpected downpours that are happening now.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Henry's Group

texts.en:
Henry's Group is formed by nine farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Henry, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 37 years old, married, and has two children. Henry has been a farmer for seven years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Henry isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has more farm group support. 

This year, Henry will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but he will also purchase two solar lights. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money.

Using this loan, Henry's Group will purchase a total of nine solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of four acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 32-year-old married mother of 4 children. 

Some time ago, Sajida's husband (shown with Sajida in the photo above) started his videography business. He owns 3 professional video cameras and requires some financial help. 

Sajida will use the loan amount to pay for the repair and maintenance costs of her husband's video cameras. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She is on her 5th loan cycle and has shown a good record of repayment. She is thankful to Kashf for her previous loans. 

Sajida is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of video cameras.

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en: Hafeezan is age 42; she is a mother of four children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, and his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business does well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Hafeezan has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. Hafeezan hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to meet the demands of her family. Hafeezan thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy pigs for the busy December season

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
Isaac's Group is made up of 14 farmers in Webuye District in Kenya. The group is represented and led by Isaac, who is pictured above. He is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. Isaac has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Isaac isn’t new to One Acre Fund. He joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed his life change, especially in the sense that he has gained a lot of respect in his community ever since. 

This year, Isaac will not only acquire fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but he will also be able to purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during the night, which will make him feel safer.

Using this loan, Isaac's Group will both purchase a total of 13 solar lights as well as use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 29-year-old married woman living with her spouse and a son in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a butcher shop; he earns insufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy beef from the market and sell it in his butcher shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which reduced his purchasing power for new inventory for his butcher shop. 

Sofia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can buy a bull calf for producing beef. Sofia wants to provide higher education to her child. She dreams of providing all facilities of life to her child. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a bull calf for producing beef.

loans.name: Begnazar

texts.en: Begnazar is 53-year-old family man who has 5 sons. He lives with his big family in the Vakhsh district. His wife is a housewife, and Begnazar is a cattle breeder and farmer. For 10 years, he has engaged in buying and selling livestock. He fattens cattle for 40-60 days and then sells it at the livestock market at a profitable price. He also has a smallholding where his family is engaged in growing crops. Begnazar simultaneously works as a chief accountant in one of the dehkan farms. The middle son of Begnazar is a student. He is studying in the third year at the Tajik State University of Commerce. His annual tuition at the university is 4522 TJS. Begnazar needs 1000 US dollars to pay his son's tuition and to purchase his school supplies. For this reason he is asking for a loan. Begnazar hopes to be supported because he would like to see his sons become educated men.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition of his son, as well as to purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She is married and together with her husband has been fishing for 11 years now. 

Marilou works hard for her four children, ages four to ten. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a new boat and fishing nets. This equipment will help her to boost her catch and have a better profit. 

Like most mothers, she hope to expand her business and increase her income so that her children can go to school and be successful with their lives.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita, 47 years old, is married with five children. She has been farming for many years and she earns a good income from this. She successfully repaid her previous loan, used for buying fertilizer, and is now planning to take a new loan to purchase new seeds and organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients to have a productive harvest. She is happy to say that with this loan the entire farm will be improved and she will rest assured for a productive farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new seeds and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn owns and operates a grocery store to earn a living. She is eager to have a profitable store and higher capital. Purchasing goods with her previous loan from GDMPC helped to increase her sales, and she has plans to expand her offerings. Her previous loan was repaid successfully, for she earned better income from it. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods and livestock feed to add to her inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate their house for a safer and more comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and livestock feed to add to her inventory

loans.name: Santa Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Unión Y Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Dolorosa en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos  mayores de edad, una hija aun viven en su casa.
Doña Santa es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para mantener el hogar, ella  tiene una tienda de víveres y un  bazar en su casa allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como aceite, arroz, detergentes, carne, pescado, queso, ropa, zapatos, tintes para cabello, entre otros muchos productos, ella también los fines de semana y feriados instala un pequeño puesto en las playas de Manta en la cual vende todo tipo de artesanías, esto le deja muy buenos ingresos y tiene más de 14 años este negocio.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para surtir aun más su tienda, ropa y artesanía. Lleva 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños son aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Unión y Fortaleza” (Unity and Strength) meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of La Dolorosa in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are frequented throughout the year. Manta is a city of unequaled beauty and it has many tourist attractions.

Sra. Santa lives in this place. She is 57 years old and a single mother of two grown children. One daughter still lives at home.

Doña Santa is a woman who enjoys working so that she can maintain her household. She has a general store and bazaar in her house where she sells all types of basic necessities such as oil, rice, detergents, meat, fish, cheese, as well as clothes, shoes, hair dyes, and many other products. On the weekends and during fairs, Santa sets up a small stand on the beaches of Manta in order to sell all types of handicrafts. She is able to generate a very good income and has been in business for more than 14 years.

The loan she is receiving will be used to buy provisions to restock her store, as well as clothes and handicrafts. She has been with the Communal Bank for six years and enjoys the benefits that she has received from the organization. Her dreams include increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions, clothing, and handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, and hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 46-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan; she is the mother of eight children. Her son owns a flower shop in which he sales various flowers, roses, rose petals, garlands and bouquets. His main work is decorating the cars for marriage ceremonies. The flower selling business is not a profitable business and the family hardly fulfills their needs. 

Now the marriage season is starting but he does not have sufficient stock of flowers to cope with the rapid increase in demand. Therefore, Irshad has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can buy more stock of roses for making garlands and bouquets. Irshad hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in the business and in their lives. Now she will be able to make more savings than before. Irshad praises and thanks Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their cooperation.

loans.use: to buy more stock of roses for making garlands and bouquets.

loans.name: Retchelle

texts.en:
Retchelle, 31 years of age, is a mother of seven children. She is married and resides in the town of Dulag, Leyte. Her oldest child is 12 and the youngest is three months old. 

Retchelle earns a living by raising and selling hogs. To augment her income, she also engages in producing tuba (coconut) wine. Her husband's occupation is a construction worker. She faces difficulty in financing her current business right now.

Retchelle has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy containers (for wine storage), tungog (used in flavoring coconut wine), and a pig.
Because of these purchases, Retchelle can produce more coconut wine and raise and sell more pigs in the coming months.

Retchelle hopes to have a stable income out of these livelihoods that would help her support the needs of her growing children, including providing quality education.

loans.use: to buy containers (for wine storage), tungog (used in flavoring coconut wine), and a pig.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been farming vegetables for 2 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock and buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Consolata's Group

texts.en:
Consolata is 40 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader who represents 9 other farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Consolata has been farming with One Acre Fund for several years now, having joined the program in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family. Although she describes her last harvest as good, she believes she will do even better this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Consolata has also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Consolata's Group will be able to receive both a total of 5 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is the 42-year-old proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and represents her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Jane has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. Jane described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

She is very excited also to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize.  She will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. 

With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.  With this loan, Jane’s group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
Stephen, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is now proud to represent his group of six farmers in Butere District. He is 55 years old, is married and has five children.

Stephen likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Stephen plans to use the profits from this coming season to repair his home.

In total, Stephen’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 2.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve his harvest

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 45-year-old woman who resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family which consists of their 5 children. 

Razia's husband has been running a restaurant for the past many years, providing good and fresh meals to his customers. His restaurant is situated in the main market in Lahore. The best shopkeepers in the area come to his restaurant to enjoy his delicious food. 

Razia's husband needs to purchase some crockery and items of fresh food so he can enhance his business. In this regard, Razia made contact with Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan to request a loan. And, as a result, BRAC has issued Razia the loan for the development of her husband's business. 

Razia is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance in her husband's restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar is a 53 year old, married woman. She is a mother of five children; she is motivated to provide good clothes and an education to her family.

Mukhtar has been doing machine embroidery at home to support her family. She has become an expert in machine embroidery but a few days ago her machine became out of order due to continuously working. Now she wants to buy a new embroidery machine to continue her business.

Mukhtar has requested a loan to buy an embroidery machine so that she can stitch more embroidered dresses to sell and could grow her income. 

She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her increased sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children. 

Mukhtar thanks to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Lucilita

texts.en:
Lucilita describes herself as a visionary. She operates a farm where she grows rice, and her husband helps her manage their farm. She has been involved in this business for over twenty  years.   Lucilita is married, with five children. 

She will use her loan to pay for farm labor and to buy farm inputs like new seeds, organic fertilizer, and pesticides to have a more productive farm. 

Her business goal is to be a successful farmer. She will use the anticipated profits to invest in her business.

loans.use: to pay for farm labor and buy farm inputs like new seeds, organic fertilizer, and pesticides to have a more productive farm.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 38 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Nenita is borrowing PHP 24,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Nenita has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Mabel Emilia

texts.es:
Mabel ha sido una ama de casa muy dedicada, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia, con sus 2 hijos; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 5 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con uno de sus hijos y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de artículos navideños, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Mabel manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales, para que tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Mabel has always been a dedicated homemaker, taking responsibility for the care of her two children. As she has always wanted to work as an independent businesswoman, she started to sell merchandise five years ago because she and one of her children had to earn money to support the household. 

Her customers are neighbours, relatives, and friends. She works alone every day in the business and finds through her work the advantage of being able to support her family. At the same time she feels productive as a businesswoman.

Mabel now needs a loan to buy Christmas articles in bulk. The end of the year is a good time to do this. These new items will allow her to offer more variety to her customers and fulfill their requests which always increase at Christmas. As a result she will earn more money for her family.

Mabel says that her greatest wish is to continue providing financial help to her family and educating all her children. She wants to see them get good jobs so they have  prosperous and successful futures.

loans.use: Buy Christmas articles in bulk

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre emprendedor de 31 años de edad, soltero y muy trabajador. 
Durante su vida productiva ha trabajado en diferentes talleres de confecciones como operario de máquina, razón por la cual posee experiencia y conocimientos en el manejo de este tipo de negocios; pero, ya cansado de trabajar en otros talleres y con el ánimo de pasar más tiempo con su familia, decidió emprender su propio taller de confección. La principal dificultad que presenta es la falta de capital para iniciar con su negocio; razón por la cual se anima a solicitar un crédito que será invertido en la compra de maquinas de3 confección e insumos como tela, hilos, agujas, entre otros.

Esto le permitirá poner en marcha su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar un buen impacto en el sector para que le genere una rentabilidad favorable y así lograr cumplir el sueño de posicionarse en el mercado y, con su empuje y ambición se proyecta en un futuro a mediano plazo generando empleo.

Haz que los sueños de Pedro Se hagan realidad con un préstamo hoy!
texts.en:
Pedro is an enterprising man of 31 years.  He's single and very hardworking.  During his productive life he has worked in different sewing shops as a machine operator, which is where he obtained his experience and knowledge of the business.  But he's tired of working in other shops, and with the intention of spending more time with his family, he's decided to start up his own sewing shop.  The biggest difficulty he faces is lack of startup capital, so he's motivated to seek a loan to invest in sewing machines and supplies like fabric, thread, needles, and other itmes.  

This will allow him to get the business going.  He hopes to make a good impact in his industry so he can generate a favorable profit and realize his dream of positioning himself in the market.  With his drive and ambition, he plans on creating jobs in the medium-term future.

Make Pedro's dreams a reality with a loan today!

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and supplies like fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther is a 39-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual. She represents her group of 10 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Esther has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Esther describes last year's harvest as good, but believes she will do even better this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. Apart from the fertilizer and maize inputs she will receive, Esther is also very excited to purchase a solar light, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, thereby saving more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With their loan, Esther’s Group will be able to not only plant a total of 5 acres of land with the fertilizer and seed inputs, but they will also be able to purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia used her previous loan to buy farm supplies, which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Florencia requested another loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fertilizer and supplies needed in maintaining her farm. She will also be able to sustain the needs of her family through the help of this loan. Florencia wants to improve their present financial condition and hopes to buy a vehicle, which she can use for trade and transport of her products. 

Florencia meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Rocio

texts.es:
Maria se dedica a la actividad de la confección desde hace aproximadamente 13 años, gracias a esto ha podido contribuir, junto con su esposo al sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. 

Maria es madre de 3 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer todo lo necesario, debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para poder sostener su hogar, Maria decidió montar un taller donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros.  

Gracias a la buena calidad de las prendas que fabrica, ha podido captar una muy buena clientela, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas ventas. 

Maria actualmente quiere aumentar la capacidad de producción de su taller con el ánimo de poder pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, es por esto que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina plana e insumos como tela, hilos y agujas.

Maria espera que de esta manera pueda cumplir su sueño de que sus hijos accedan a una educación universitaria, además, de poder mejorarle la calidad de vida a su familia. 

Maria espera que su taller aumente las ventas considerablemente y en un futuro hacerlo crecer y poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. 

Ayuda con un préstamo el taller de Maria!
texts.en:
Maria has been working as a seamstress for about thirteen years. This work has allowed her to contribute to covering her household expenses alongside her husband. She has three children for whom she has always wanted to provide as best she could. Her husband's income was not enough to support the family, so Maria decided to set up a sewing shop, where she offers her services to third parties. The high quality of the clothing items she makes has allowed her to acquire a very good customer base, which in turn has translated into very good sales.

Maria currently wants to increase her shop's production capacity. She wants to be able to pay for her children's higher education costs, which is why she wants to purchase a flat sewing machine and supplies like fabric, thread, and needles. Maria believes a loan will enable her to make these purchases and also to achieve her dream of putting her children through college. She also wants to improve her family's quality of life. 

Maria hopes her sales to increase substantially so that in the future her business can grow and generate employment opportunities for people in need. Help out by lending to Maria's shop!

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies like fabric, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Ann's Group

texts.en:
Ann, pictured above, has seven children and is always described as a very experienced farmer, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Ann is representing her group of nine farmers in Butere District and she is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Ann has been a farmer for 15 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. 

Her loan will not only include farming inputs, but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting since that means she will now have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, Ann is planning to send her children to school.

A total of 4.75 acres will be planted by Ann's Group and, between them, they will receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Myriam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con su gran empuje y perseverancia, Myriam ha salido adelante y ha podido educar y sostener a su familia conformada por sus 2 hijos ya que su esposo falleció hace algún tiempo.

Siempre ha buscado la manera de obtener ingresos para su familia, tanto así que ha pasado por numerosos trabajos en el municipio de Sabaneta.

Hoy en día, después de haber decidido por su independencia, trabaja en la fabricación de artículos y objetos artesanales con motivos de navidad.

Por esta y muchas más razones solicita un préstamo para compra materia prima como e insumos como agujas y pegas para la fabricación de su artículos.

Con este préstamo podrá asegurar la sostenibilidad de su negocio y por ende de su familia.

Si prestas a este crédito estarás aportando al progreso y empuje Colombiano!
texts.en:
With her great drive and perseverance, Myriam has gotten ahead and has been able to raise her two children and provide for her family, since her husband passed away some time ago. She has always found a way to obtain income for her family, so much so that she has held many jobs in Sabaneta.Today, after having decided to work for herself, she makes crafts and Christmas items.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials and supplies like needles and glue in order to make her items. This loan will allow her to secure her business' sustainability as well as, in turn, her family's.

By lending to this borrower you will be supporting Colombian progress and drive!

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies.

loans.name: Sanjaya

texts.en:
Sanjaya is 37 years old, a differently-able man who lives with his wife and three children in Kalahandi district of Odisha state. His children are in school. He owns a grocery store where he sells sugar, flour, rice, edible oil, biscuits, cosmetics, spices, packaged snack items and cold drinks. He earns 5,000 INR per month which is not sufficient for his monthly family expenses as his three children are studying in school and he has to pay for their education costs also.

Sanjaya is a very hardworking man. His store is open from 7 am to 9 pm daily, but he lacks working capital to invest in his business. He is requesting this loan to have working capital so that he can manage his store portfolio regularly. He will use this loan to purchase sugar, rice, edible oil, spices, cosmetics and packaged snack items in bulk. He is grateful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, edible oil, spices, cosmetics and packaged snack items in bulk

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 37 years old, a married woman, and a mother of four daughters. Her husband is a driver by profession and he provides transportation services, using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Saima has applied for a loan for her husband from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Saima is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Saima gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Easther

texts.en:
Easther is a 29-year-old woman, living in Lui and she as children, but the father of her children died three years ago. 

Easther has requested a loan of  SSP 300. She runs her own business by making bread to sell next to her house and she is trying to do more business  in the future.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Jogendra

texts.en:
Jogendra is 35 years old, a differently-able man who lives with his parents, wife and one son in a small village of Mayurbhanj district of Odisha state, India. His son is 10 years old and is in school. His son goes to a government school near his house. 

Jogendra sells peanuts at nearby market and makes 3,000 INR per month. He does not have a single place (that is, a shop) so he has to move every time to sell his peanuts. He has a plan to take a shop on rent at the market so that he can store peanuts in bulk for resale. He will use this loan to pay the security money for his new store.

He is very happy with this loan and hopes to do well for his business.

loans.use: to pay the security money for his new store

loans.name: Maria Shg Group

texts.en:
Kungthuilu is a shopkeeper who sells shirts, pants, shawls and skirts to earn a living. She is a mother of two children and is featured with her hand raised. The elder child goes to school while the younger one is not yet in school. She is the featured borrower of the group. She joined Maria Group in the year 2013 and started selling clothing at her home with the loan she accessed from WSDS. 

As there were few customers, she shifted her business place to the market which is a few kilometers away from her village in hopes of getting more customers. Customers from different villages came to buy clothes from her shop. With the income, she provides the household's daily needs. Her husband is a daily wage earner with a small income engaged in masonry work. 

Kungthuilu now aspires to buy a scooter to use in her business so that she can carry goods for selling purposes and save transportation charges. At the same time, it will be very convenient for her to ride a scooter from her home to the business place instead of walking by foot.

 With the Kiva loan, she will buy a stock of garments to sell in her shop. As the festive season is approaching, customers will be more numerous than on other business days. She wanted to grab the chance to sell more in the coming festive season and generate more income like other business people. She said, “Thank you Kiva for being part of fulfilling my dreams.” 

Kungthuilu sends good wishes to the lenders. All the group members are engaged in weaving, piggery and variety stores for their livelihood. They are all very hard-working and believe in the financial independence of all.

loans.use: To buy a stock of garments to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Nirupama

texts.en:
Nirupama is 36 years old, a divorced mother who lives with her parents and one son in a small village in Angul district, Odisha, India. Her son's age is 13 and he is in school. 

Nirupama is engaged in a tailoring business and earns 4,000 INR per month. She uses her income for monthly household expenses and her son's education. She wants to give a better education to her child so she is planning to expand her tailoring service business. She has requested a loan to buy a stitching machine and thread for her tailoring business.

She hopes to open a cloth store in future. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to purchase a stitching machine and thread

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sol Naciente” está conformado por 08 socios solidarios y responsables. Norma de 25 años de edad es separada y  tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la compostura de prendas de vestir, Hace más de 04 años viene desempeñándose en dicho negocio, producto a su esfuerzo pudo comprarse su terreno. Su mayor deseo es complementar su negocio con la venta de comida. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de telas, cierres, hilos y agujas.
