El grupo “Sol Naciente” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Norma se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo rojo. En la parte superior a lado izquierdo se encuentra Mónica la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The group “Sol Naciente” is made up of 8 united and responsible members.  Norma is 25 years old, separated and she has 2 dependent children.  She works at sewing clothing.  For more than 4 years ago she has been carrying out this business.  As a product of her efforts she was able to buy herself land.  Her greatest desire is to complement her business with the sale of food.

She asked for a loan in order to buy fabric, fasteners, thread and needles.  The “Sol Naciente” group thanks all the Kiva investors for making this loan possible.

Norma is found seated, the first on the right side, wearing a red top.  In the upper part on the left side is Monica who was not able to arrive on time because she was working.

loans.use: to buy fabric, fasteners, thread and needles

loans.name: Miguelina De Jesus

texts.es:
Miguelina es el claro ejemplo de una campesina antioqueña una persona amable, sonriente, luchadora que a pesar que su esposo la abandono fue capaz de levantarse y montar un negocio de producción agrícola, cultiva plátanos y con ello crio a sus 2 hijos que hoy en día son mayores de edad.
Los conocimientos del campo los aprendió gracias a un familiar y ahora quiere mejorar su ventas, aumentar sus clientes y reponerse de las pérdidas que le significo esta ola invernal que ha arrasado con cultivos dejando casi sin nada.
La principal ventaja que tiene Miguelina es que sabe levantarse de situaciones adversas por ello solicita un crédito para invertirlo en abonos, riegos, fertilizantes insumos, que serán de vital importancia para su negocio.
texts.en:
Miguelina is a clear example of an Antioquian farmer: she is kind, cheerful, and driven. In spite of her husband having left her, she was able to stand up and start her own farming business. She grows plantains, and her business allowed her to raise her two children who are now adults.

She learned how to farm from a relative, and she now wants to improve her sales, increase her customer base, and recover from the losses she suffered due to the cold wave that has destroyed the crops, leaving hardly anything behind. Miguelina's main advantage in this situation is that she knows how to come back from adversity. She is requesting a loan to invest in fertilizer and irrigation supplies, which are going to be vitally important for her business.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer and irrigation supplies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She earns additional income from farming coconuts. 

Vilma requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy piglets, feeds, and vitamins for her pig fattening business. She hopes to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feeds, and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Pauline's Group

texts.en:
Pauline is a 47-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 8 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Pauline has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Pauline described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Pauline’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 33 years old, an unmarried lady who lives with her parents and siblings. She lives and works in a small town called Banarpal of Angul district, Odisha, India. She is engaged in a tailoring service business. She makes both ladies' and gents' clothing. She takes orders from customers and makes their garments. She is a very hardworking lady. She says, "I always want to see my parents happy."

Lina has requested a loan to buy cloth and thread for dressmaking. Lina has a dream to build a house for her elderly parents.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread for dressmaking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Sukamaju Group

texts.en:
The Rukun Group is led by the 40 year-old farmer Tri, who is standing third from the left and pointing his thumbs up in the photo. The other farmers in the group are Anto, Yatno, Wawan, Tono. They are standing in front of a bio-digester.  Tri has a family with four children. All of them live in Trengguli, a small village in Karanganyar, Indonesia.

Tri has been running cow-fattening farming for more than a year. He also operates a small-scale vegetable farming. His business is going well. However, he started getting protests from his neighbors because cow dungs that is thrown into a small field near his house causing a pungent odor.

After socialized by Yayasan Rumah Energi and LKM (a local NGO – biogas construction partner of YRE) about Household Biogas (BIRU) program, Tri saw an opportunity to reduce his dependence on non- renewable cooking gas. Moreover, Indonesia Government has issued fuel price increasing policy. It makes him and his farmer friends want to become energy-independent by purchasing bio-digesters. But Tri does not have sufficient capital to purchase a bio-digester, a loan from Kiva will help him and other farmer group members to make it possible.

He hopes that if he can build bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizers for his plantation. He want to share the remaining bio-slurry to his farming neighbor.

loans.use: to build bio-digesters and utilization of biogas residue as organic fertilizer

loans.name: Campo Elias

texts.es: A sus 50 años de edad Campo esta casado, tiene 4 hijos pero solo uno aun vive con Campo, su esposa se dedica al trabajar al jornal, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono, fungicidas y para pagar mano de obra para tener sus cultivos en buen estado, la aspiración de Campo es seguir trabajando     mejorar sus cosechas y asi mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
At 50 years of age, Campo is married and has 4 children, but only one of them still lives with him.  His wife works as a day-labourer.  The loan is going to be invested in the purchase of manure and fungicides and to pay for labour to have his crops in good condition.  

Campo's aspiration is to continue working to improve his harvests and thus improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicides

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Yessenia nació en el municipio de Acoyapa en el año 1974, quien ha vivido siempre en ese municipio, actualmente está casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años. Yessenia se dedica a la ganadería lo que representa su mayor fuente de ingresos. Yessenia desea comprar un biodigestor para poder cocinar con biogás y dejar de utilizar la leña ya que es muy malo para su salud y la de su familia, ademas ella está consciente que al eliminar el uso de la leña estará ayudando a la conservación del medio ambiente; además de eso ella utilizará el biol para fertilizar el pasto que consume su ganado y de esta manera obtener un producto de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Yessenia was born in the municipality of Acoyapa in 1974.  She has always lived in this municipality.  Now she is married and has a four-year-old child.  Yessenia make a living raising cattle, which represents the largest source of her income. 

Yessenia wants to buy a biodigester to be able to cook with biogas and to stop using wood since it is very bad for her health and the health of her family.  Besides, she is conscious that eliminating the use of wood will be helping in the conservation of the environment.  Besides that, she will use the biol to fertilize the feed pasture for the cattle and in this way get a better quality product.

loans.use: to buy a biodigester

loans.name: Lideres De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Líderes De Santa Rosa” grupo responsables conformado por 10 socios emprendedores. Este es el caso de Rosa de 59 años de edad separada con 02 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de juguetes y perfumería. Hace más de 10 años que viene desempeñándose en dicho negocio, gracias a su esfuerzo le va bien y ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de muñecas, perfumes y colonias. El grupo “Líderes De Santa Rosa” agradece a todos los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible dicho crédito. Rosa es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste casaca celeste.
texts.en: The communal banking group "Leaders of Santa Rosa" is made up of 10 entrepreneurial members. Rosa is one, and she is 59 years old. She is separated with two grown children.  She works selling toys and perfume.  She has been working in this field for the past ten years. Thanks to her efforts things are going well and she has been able to improve her quality of life.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase dolls, perfume and cologne.  The group "Leaders of Santa Rosa" thanks all the Kiva lenders for making such loans possible.  Rosa is the first woman on the left side in the picture, and she is wearing a light blue jacket.

loans.use: To purchase dolls, perfume and cologne.

loans.name: Maharramkhon

texts.ru: Мухаррамхон проживает на районе Дж.Руми. Район был назван в честь великого таджикского писателя Джалохиддина Руми. Мухаррамхон занимается продажей тканей на местном рынке. Она живет одна. Ее дочери вышли замуж и с мужьями живут отдельно. Мухаррамхону 49 лет. Она хочет сделать ремонт дома и создать хорошие условия. У Мухаррамхона не хватает денег для приобретения стройматериалов, чтобы подготовить дом к предстоящим холодам. Она видит выход только в получении кредита. Помогите Мухаррамхону купить стройматериалы и сделать ремонт, тогда она сможет без проблем пережить зиму.
texts.en: Maharramkhon lives in the J. Rumy district. This district was named after a great Tajik writer, Jalohiddin Rumy. Maharramkhon is involved in selling fabrics at a local market. She lives alone. Her daughters got married and live separately with their husbands. Maharramkhon is 49 years old. She wants to make repairs at home and create good living conditions. Maharramkhon does not have enough money to buy construction materials to prepare her house for the upcoming cold weather. She sees obtaining a loan as the only solution. Please help Maharramkhon to buy construction materials and do repairs, and then she would be able to live through the winter without problems.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to repair her house

loans.name: Liberito

texts.en: Liberito is married with five children, and he runs a general store selling goods in the village to make a living. He has been doing this for over eleven years and earns a good income for his family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used for buying fishing equipment for his fishing business. To increase the sales in his store, he took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase additional grocery goods, rice, and feed to sell in his store. He is still hopeful that he will gain more income to expand his business to ensure a better source of income for his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods, rice, and feed to sell in his store in order to increase sales

loans.name: Zhumakan

texts.ru: Жумакан 38 лет, замужем, есть дочь - школьница. Образование среднее, уже 5 лет Жумакан занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее есть 3 коровы, 20 овец и 2 лошади. На участке мерою 1,60 ГА она выращивает картофель, клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль Жумакан на сегодняшний день доходит до 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 8 овец для дальнейшей их перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Жумакан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Zhumakan is 38 years old, married and has a school-age daughter. Zhumakan has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for 5 years. She has 3 cows, 20 sheep and 2 horses. She grows potatoes and clover for the farm use and sale on 1.60 hectares of land. Today, Zhumakan's monthly profit reaches about 14,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 8 sheep for subsequent resale. Zhumakan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business in order to save money for repairing her house.

loans.use: to buy 8 sheep for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Tellem Leikai Shg Group

texts.en:
“Making lovely shawls requires intense devotion and passion while weaving. Talent is also one important means to successful business in weaving,” says Asha. She is pictured with her hand raised as the featured borrower of the group. She lives with her sons who are in kindergarten and primary school. Her husband serves in the army and is posted in a different state. 

Asha manages the family with the amount sent by her husband from his posting place. As the money sent by her husband could not totally meet their needs, she took up earning supplementary income  by weaving shawls. She has been very good at weaving since she was a young lass which led her to choose this occupation for income generation. 

Asha joined the group in the year 2012 and accessed a loan from WSDS to use in her weaving. The loan gave her the opportunity to improve her weaving business a lot. She provides household expenses from the income she generate from weaving. Now she wants to access a loan to buy yarn for weaving lovely shawls and selling them in the market. She wants to produce many lovely shawls that will captivate many customers in the market. By selling shawls, she will get profit that will help her in maintaining the household. 

Asha is very happy and content with the loan. She also thanks Kiva lenders for their generosity. The rest of the group members are also engaged in weaving. They are very happy to access the loan which helps them to improve their weaving businesses. They are all very hard-working and strive to attain financial freedom.

loans.use: to buy yarn to use in weaving lovely shawls.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is single, lives with her parents and two brothers. She is the oldest. She works part time, and she also goes to school. She is supporting her parents financially and takes care of her two youngest brothers. Recently she visited the doctor to get a vision exam because she was having trouble seeing objects from a far distance, and she was diagnosed with an eye retina problem and an emergency procedure had to be made. She is using this loan to pay for the eye surgery performed.

loans.use: to pay for an eye surgery

loans.name: Yaiphabi Shg Group

texts.en:
“I work in the river quarry sieving sand as a means of livelihood,” says Binasakhi, a 41-year-old hard-working woman. For the past several years, she choose this sand-sieving occupation to support her family including three school-going children. They live in Yairipok Khoirom village situated near a riverbed where most of the villagers are engaged in sand-sieving as their main occupation. 

Binasakhi is the featured borrower of the group, pictured with her hand raised. Her husband is a daily labourer engaged as a mason with a small income. She also weaves wraparounds at home in the evenings for income generation when she is free. She wants to buy tools used in sand-sieving for her personal use so that she can work privately when she does not get any work from the employer. There are many workers in the river quarry and most of the days, the needed labour is exceeded by the number of labourers. 

With the Kiva loan, Binasakhi will buy the required tools for sand-sieving to use in private. She will also pay for hiring trucks and labour charges for transportation of the sand to the customers. She will save up money for the children’s school fees for the new session and for buying new textbooks and other stationery items. 

Binasakhi is very happy to get the loan and prays for a successful business. She also wishes success to the lenders. All the group members are excited to get the loan. They earn their livelihood by engaging in sand sieving, selling rice, poultry and weaving to achieve their financial goals.

loans.use: to buy tools required in sand-sieving and to pay for hiring trucks for carrying sand to sell.

loans.name: Etilvia Rosa

texts.es:
Etilvia es una mujer campesina madre de 5 hijos ya ellos mayores de edad, junto con su esposo encontró miles de dificultades junto con su esposo para poder criar y alimentar a una familia numero incluso le toco salir de su hogar a las diferentes veredas y calles vendiendo productos como ventiladores, ropa y electrodomésticos lo más impresionante es que esta asombrosa mujer cargaba los objetos incluso se desplazaba a pie.
Gracias a esta actividad Etilvia Pudo solventar la crisis financiera que tenían y se volvió dependiente de este negocio por lo que ahora pide una ayuda para comprar surtido en ventiladores, ropa, y electrodomésticos y como en añso anteriores salir a vender sus productos para ayudar a llevar el sustento diario a su familia.
texts.en:
Etilvia is a rural woman with five grown children. Together with her husband, she has encountered a number of difficulties raising and feeding a large family. She even had to sell products such as fans, clothing and appliances on the street. The most impressive part is that this amazing woman carried these objects and moved them around on foot. 

Thanks to her work, Etilvia managed to straighten out her financial problems, and became dependent upon this business. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase various fans, clothing items, and appliances, and once again sell these products to help provide for her family every day.

loans.use: to purchase fans, clothing, and appliances to be sold on the street.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget is a twenty-year-old single lady living in Kasese, Uganda. Bridget operates a boutique of ladies' clothes in order to have a daily income. She has a dream of expanding the business into a big shopping center. However, she is faced with the challenge of market competition and the ever-changing fashions and designs. Bridget needs a loan to buy ladies' shoes, dresses, blouses, bags and other items to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy ladies' shoes, dresses, blouses, bags and other items to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married, lives with her husband and has a 3 year old daughter. She works part time in a bank to help her husband financially, while her mother takes care of her daughter. For a few years she has had difficulty locating objects from a far distance, which is now affecting her in her job function. The only option she has is to have surgery to correct her vision problem. Due to economic reasons in the past the surgery could not be performed. Recently she and her husband went to have a vision exam, and the doctor told her that she was a good candidate to have the surgery done. She is using this loan to pay for the eye surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married and a father of two daughters and currently lives with his family. He has been working in a construction company for a few years now. He is responsible, consistent and hardworking. He takes care of his father who is retired. He started to develop vision problems and it got to the point where it started to affect his job duties. He recently visited the doctor to get a vision exam and the doctor told him he was a good candidate to have the surgery performed. He is using this loan to pay his surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married, lives with her husband and two children. She currently works as an operator in a manufacturing company. She is a very dedicated mother and takes care of her family. Her husband is retired. Her oldest child has developed a hereditary vision problem that is affecting him on his daily life activities since he cannot see from  a far distance. The only option to correct his problem is an eye surgery. The mother is requesting the loan to help her son to have the eye surgery done.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married and lives with his wife and two children. He currently works for a bus driving company. He is a hardworking and responsible father. He works very hard to provide for them. His wife recently developed a vision problem that is preventing her from her daily duties, and she is constantly having headaches and pain in her eyes. The only option for her is to have an eye surgery. He is requesting the loan to help his wife to have the eye surgery performed.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Lanjangba Shg Group

texts.en:
“My husband and I run a grocery store to support ourselves,” says Chanbi, pictured with her hand raised. She is the featured borrower of the group. Chanbi is a very friendly and caring person. She works hard to meet the daily needs of her family. She is very well-mannered with the customers and that is one reason that keeps her business going. She aspires to innovate in her grocery store by selling items that will attract more customers. Customers usually flock to those stores that sell a greater number of items. 

Chanbi cannot compete with those stores due to lack of financial resources. With the Kiva loan, she will buy a stock of grocery items to sell in her store. She has high hopes of meeting regular customers' needs and attracting many more customers. The income derived from the store will be used to support their family's daily needs and the educational fees of the children. 

Chanbi is so thankful to Kiva for being part of fulfilling her dreams. The other group members are engaged in grocery stores, weaving and sand-sieving to help themselves through the Kiva loan. They are all determined to achieve their financial goals.

loans.use: to buy a stock of groceries to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза, 27 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование Наргизы - среднее, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 9 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Наргизы, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 1 корова и 0,50 ГА земельной доли, где она выращивает картофель для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Наргиза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одного бычка. Доходы от кредита Наргиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Nargiza is 27 years old, married and has 4 children. Nargiza has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 9 years. Thanks to Nargiza's hard work, at the present time her farm contains 1 cow and 0.50 hectares of land, where grows potatoes for sale. In order to further develop her business, Nargiza requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy one bull. Nargiza plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy one bull for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married and lives with his wife and one daughter. He is a dedicated father and wants the best for his family. He's currently employed in a company were he had a couple of work related accidents, A few months ago he was diagnosed with an eye retina problem and needs surgery. His vision problem is affecting his job duties. Due to economic reasons in the past, he was not able to have the surgery performed. He is using this loan to pay for the eye surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Guillermo David

texts.es:
Guillermo un hombre  de 50 años dedicado al mundo de la pesca, que aprendió  ejerció gracias a su padre quien le enseño todos sus secretos de este oficio, que trabaje diariamente con una constancia de trabajo variable, dedicándole al negocio todo el tiempo que demande.
Guillermo es un hombre humilde y muy responsable que presenta una dificultar para el libre desarrollo de su actividad y es que tiene que arreglar las mayas de su estanque y comprar la comida de estos peces, para que crezcan y se engorden.
Como no dispone del capital y es una urgencia, el señor miguel solicitara un crédito para invertir en lo anteriormente mencionado.
Su principal beneficio es que los peces ya no se escaparan por los agujeros de las mayas.
SU sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y junto con su pareja disfrutar de una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 50 year-old man who makes a living fishing, an activity that he learned from his father. He works everyday dealing with the variability of the job and devoting as much time as necessary. Guillermo is a modest and very responsible man who has a limitation to the free development of his activity: he needs to repair the net of his pond and buy food for the fish, so that they can grow and get bigger. 

Given that this is urgent and that he does not have enough capital to cover it, he is requesting a loan to invest in the mentioned repair. His main benefit will be that the fish will no longer escape through the holes of the net. 

His dream is to improve his house and to enjoy a good quality of life with his partner.

loans.use: to repair the net of his pond and to buy food for the fish. He currently has financial losses because the fish are able to escape.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married and lives with his family. He continues to work to support his family. Even though he's retired, he is a hardworking and responsible man. His wife was detected with a vision problem and needs a surgery to correct her problem. She recently visited the doctor to get a vision exam since her family has a history of eye related problems.  At the eye exam, she realized she was having difficulty seeing objects from a far distance. He is requesting this loan to help his wife to have the eye surgery performed.

loans.use: To Have an eye surgery

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis un joven de 24 años de edad, soltero y con ganas de triunfar y salir adelante, que con la ayuda de un crédito se lanzara al emprendimiento montando un salón de belleza, un proyecto que lo tiene asustado pues será su primera experiencia como empresa y le pondrá todas las ganas y empeño para sacar su proyecto adelante.
Por lo pronto necesita de urgencia una ayuda crediticia que invertirá en la compra de muebles, auxiliares para implementos de peluquería.
Este crédito le permitirá amoblar su local e iniciar a trabajar para crear en un futuro un centro de estética.
texts.en:
Luis is a 24 year-old single man who aspires to succeed and move forward. With the help of a loan he will launch his business venture; opening a beauty salon. Whilst he is nervous about this project because it will be his first experience of running a business, he will put all his enthusiasm and effort into making it a success. 

In the meantime he urgently needs financial help to buy furniture, helpers and hairdressing implements.

This loan will allow him to furnish his business and start working to create a styling centre in the near future.

loans.use: to furnish his entire business. He is a young gay man who wants to succeed and earn his own living

loans.name: Zhanyl

texts.ru: Жаныл, 43 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Жаныл среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, вместе с супругом занимаются животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, Жаныл на сегодняшний день имеет 3 коровы, 15 лошадей. У нее очень хорошая прибыль от бизнеса - 60,000 сом в месяц (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жаныл обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошадей. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, а также она мечтает построить продуктовый магазин возле дома.
texts.en: Zhanyl is 43 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Zhanyl has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, she and her husband have been involved in animal husbandry for 9 years. Thanks to her hard work, today Zhanyl has 3 cows and 15 horses. She has a very good profit from the business - 60,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop her business, Zhanyl requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy horses. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and also dreams of building a food store near her home.

loans.use: to buy additional horses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Leidy Yolima

texts.es:
Leidy, es una joven de 24 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 2009, monto su negocio ofreciendo accesorios para celulares, con el cual ha tenido gran acogida durante los años que lleva de funcionamiento. 

Leidy se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como accesorios, protectores de pantalla, equipos de diversas gamas, entre otros, con el fin de darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leidy is 24 years old and started working some time ago, but whatever jobs she had she always had in mind a desire of going into sales. That is how in early 2009 she started her business, which offers cell phone accessories and has been very well received over the years since it opened.

Leidy is known to be a driven and kind person, a woman with a vision who is very eager to get ahead. That is why she has decided to request a loan, so that she can invest it in buying merchandise like accessories, screen protectors, and different types of equipment. This will allow her to boost her business' image, attract more customers, and offer them a wide variety of products so that the needs and preferences of everyone who comes to her store are met. 

This way she will be able to continue contributing to her household economy and save up in order to open more branches and substantially improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like phone accessories, screen protectors, and other equipment.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El señor Nelson desde muy joven se dedico a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y ganadería, actividades que le enseño su padre para que saliera adelante en su vida.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la agricultura y la ganadería y tiene como objetivo mejorar su capital comprando un toro que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos con la producción vacuna y esta es la razón por la cual solicita un préstamo con la Corporación Interactuar.

Esta es una actividad muy común en esta región del país y la mayoría de sus habitantes viven de este oficio.


Es padre responsable y amoroso con sus hijos, vive en una finca con ellos y su esposa quien ha sido su más grande compañía y apoyo.

Sueña con poder otorgarles a sus hijos una educación de calidad para que más adelante se puedan defender solos y sean independientes.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien para que en un futuro su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda se haga realidad.
texts.en:
From a young age, Nelson has worked in the countryside doing work that his father taught him, such as farming and raising cattle, so that he would be successful in life.

These days, his main business is farming and raising cattle and his objective is to improve his capital by buying a bull that will allow him to stock up and generate a better income with cow production. This is the reason he is requesting a loan from Interactuar.

This is a common activity in this region of the country and the majority of its citizens live off of this profession.

He is a loving and responsible father to his children, he lives on a farm with them and his wife who has been his greatest company and support.

He dreams of being able to give his children a quality education so that later on they will be able to defend themselves and be independent. 

He goes to work each day and he makes sure to work hard so that in the future his dream of improving the conditions of his home become reality.

loans.use: to buy a bull for his cattle ranch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for his business

loans.name: Campo Elias

texts.es:
Padre de 1 hijo y con un gran deseo verlo convertido en todo un profesional es el motivo que llena de entusiasmo y animo la señor Campo Elías de 42 años de edad a trabajar incansablemente en su criadero de cerdos pues aspira a que con esta humilde profesión pueda brindarle una educación universitaria de calidad. 

Desde hace 10 años se gana la vida con este oficio y cada día piensa en la forma de mejorarlo y hacerlo crecer, es por eso que solicita ayuda a la Corporación Interactuar para que su negocio tenga la oportunidad de establecerse como un modelo rentable y duradero.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar alimentos y materiales para la adecuación del corral en el que alberga sus animales.

De este modo podrá cumplir su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de trabajo.

Ayuda a Campo Elías para que sus cerdos tengan una muy buena producción!
texts.en:
Campo Elías is a 42 year-old man who has one son and a strong will to see him becoming a professional. This is his reason for working non-stop and with energy and enthusiasm in his pigs' breeding center. He expects that his modest job will provide him with a quality university education.

He has been in the business for 10 years and looks for ways to improve and expand it every day. This is why he is requesting a loan to the Corporación Interactuar. His goal is for his business to consolidate as a profitable and sustainable model. He will use the loan to buy food and materials to improve the pen where he keeps the animals. This way he will be able to reach his dream of improving his work conditions. 

Please help Campo Elías so that his pigs can provide a good product!

loans.use: to buy food and materials to improve the pen where he keeps his animals.

loans.name: Yesica Yohana

texts.es:
Ella es Yesica, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposo y sus hijos.

Ella se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas y bebidas desde hace aproximadamente 2 años en un pequeño espacio en su casa con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empirica y por la necesidad económica de su familia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar una nevera y surtido de gaseosas, dulces y otros.

Es una mujer que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
This is Yesica, a strong and kind woman who is willing to improve and get ahead with his husband and children. She decided to start her business 2 years ago cooking and selling food. She uses a small space in her house and works with energy and enthusiasm. She learned the job herself to meet the financial needs of her family. 

She now wants to expand the business and is requesting a loan to buy a fridge, refreshments, sweet items and other products. 

She is a woman that takes on challenges with courage for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, refreshments, sweet items and other products.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 58-year-old married mother of five grown children from Concepcion, Iloilo. A dressmaker for more than five years now, she is requesting a loan to buy more cloth, needles and thread and to pay for the repair of her sewing machine. This loan will help her improve her business and income.

Rosie hopes to make her business sustainable and more productive.

loans.use: to pay for more cloth, needles, thread and repair of the sewing machine

loans.name: Lowell

texts.en:
Lowell earns a living from selling goods in his retail store. For five years, Lowell has earned well and improved the business. His earnings go to his  children's education costs. 

To add inventory capital, he has borrowed from GDMPC microcredit to buy more grocery items like rice, canned goods, flour, and sugar to sell in his store.

He hopes to have more business, which will generate additional income for providing better education to his children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like rice, canned goods, flour, and sugar to sell in his store

loans.name: Zikamo

texts.ru:
Зикамо 51 летняя жительница не большого района Сарбанд. Она добрая жена и любимая мама. Дети Зикамо учатся и работают. Зикамо мудрая женщина, общение с ней доставляет только удовольствие. Она уже 10 лет занимается шитьем национальных матрасов или как их называют в народе "курпа" и "курпача".
   "Курпа" и "курпача"- это ватные матрасы. "Курпа" шьют стандартно квадратном размере, ее используют в качестве одеяла. Курпача длинные матрасы используется как диваны.
  "Курпа" использовали с давних времен и используют до сих пор. Они немножко тяжелые по сравнению с заводскими одеялами, но сохраняют тепло гораздо дольше. Сейчас для Зикамо сезон работы. И она решила купить большое количество ваты, тканей и ниток, чтобы шить и продать больше ватных матрасов. На реализацию покупки у не хватает не большой суммы и она решила обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en:
Zikamo is a 51-year-old woman from a small district of Sarband. She is a kind wife and a loving mother. Zikamo's children study and work. Zikamo is a wise woman, and it is just a pleasure talking to her. She has been involved in sewing national mattresses, or "kurpa" and "kurpacha", as they are commonly referred to, for 10 years. 

"Kurpa' and "kurpacha" are cotton-filled mattresses. "Kurpa" is customarily sewn in a square form and used as a blanket. Kurpacha are long mattresses used as couches. "Kurpa" has been used since ancient times and is still used to this day. They are slightly heavier compared to factory blankets, but keep the heat a lot longer. This is Zikamo's work season, and she decided to buy a larger amount of cotton, fabric and threads in order to sew and sell more cotton-filled mattresses. She is short a small amount of money to make this purchase and decided to request this loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of cotton, fabric and threads in order to sew and sell more cotton-filled mattresses

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is married and has two children and lives currently with his family. He works for a bus driving company. He describes himself as a hardworking man. Recently Juan and his wife visited the doctor to get a vision exam since his family has had a history of eye-related problems. When he went to the eye exam he was having trouble seeing objects from a far distance. Because of financial reasons he did not have the income to have the surgery done in the past. He started to develop vision problems and is now to a point that it is affecting him on his job. He was disabled for quite some time before. He currently helps his parents financially and because of that matter he couldn't get the surgery procedure done in the past. He is using this loan to have the eye surgery performed.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married, lives with his wife and one daugther. He is now retired, and he takes care of his grandsons. He is a hardworking and responsible man. He has developed vision problems and had to change glasses constantly. They detected he had a vision problem to be able to see far distances. They suggested he have surgery performed to correct his vision problem, but due to economic reasons he could not have the surgery performed. He is using this loan to pay the eye surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is married and has four children who attend school. She operates a business selling paraffin for use in cooking. Her customers are her neighbors.  She faces a challenge of delayed payments resulting in low profits.

Emily requested a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase cements and sand for construction. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: to purchase cements and sand

loans.name: Ason

texts.en:
Ason is married, with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

For ten years Ason has been running a retail shop of general merchandise to earn a living. He also has a grinding machine to supplement his income. 

Ason wants money to buy ground nuts for grinding to sell. Ason has a dream of expanding his business of ground nuts supply into other markets. However, he faces the challenge of seasonality, such as drought and heavy rains.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts for grinding to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, a 34-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid two past loans from NWTF; she is requesting a new one for PHP 15000 to buy additional items to sell such as coffee, canned goods, snack foods, sugar, eggs, etc. 

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as coffee, canned goods, snack foods, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en: Santiago is married and lives with his wife and children. He has been working for a manufacturing company for a few years now.  He started to develop vision problems and it got to the point where it started to affect his job duties and was therefore disabled for some time.  He currently helps his parents financially and for this reason had been unable to get the surgery done. He is using this loan to have the eye surgery performed.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Edirlanda

texts.es:
Edirlanda es una mujer muy capaz, inteligente y persistente que en vista de las necesidades económicas que presentaba en su hogar, decidió buscar soluciones y con base a sus conocimientos de culinaria que aprendió gracias a amigos, familiares etc. monto un puesto de comida que hoy carece de muchos activos pero es funcional.
Edirlanda busca a través de un crédito comprar activos para su negocio, como un horno de gas, un microondas, sillas, mesas, cucharones, ollas y varias cosas que carece en el momento.
La ayuda de este crédito será un gran empuje para esta madre de dos hijas de 14 y 16 años que no dispone de alguien en que apoyarse solo tiene a interactuar que confía en su proyecto y la apoyara para hacer de su venta de comida un futuro restaurante exitoso y que le permita decirle a sus hijas pueden estudiar en una universidad pues podemos pagarles una matrícula que es su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Edirlanda is a very capable, intelligent and persistent woman. Faced with the economic needs of her home, she decided to seek solutions based on her culinary skills - learned through friends, family etc. - to set up a food stand which today lacks many items but is functional.

Edirlanda is asking for a loan in order to buy items for her business, such as a gas oven, microwave, chairs, tables, ladles, pots and various items which she doesn't yet have.

The help provided by this loan will give a big boost for this mother of two daughters aged 14 and 16. She has no-one to lean on and has to engage to gain trust in her project and support to make her food stall into a successful restaurant in the future. This will let her tell her daughters that they can study at university as she can pay the fees. That is her dream.

loans.use: to buy a gas oven, chairs, tables, microwaves and various items. Her dream is to have a restaurant.

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 50 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a plumber, which he has been doing for many years and fulfilling all the expense of his family, alone. He provides the services for underground piping connections, fitting of taps, and digging wells. He retains a list of good customers and his business is doing well. 

Shehnaz's son's tools have been wearing out and he wants to buy new tools such as a wrench, tube cutter, pipe threader, tube flaring, soldering torch, tile spade, shovel, and digging bar to continue his services but he does not have enough cash in hand. Therefore, Shehnaz requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her son will use to buy plumbing tools.

loans.use: to purchase tools for digging well.

loans.name: Annah's Group

texts.en:
Annah, featured in the above photo, is representing her farming group, which was formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. She is 58 years old and the married mother of nine children, She is often described as a very hardworking individual. 

Although Annah has been a farmer for more than 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund.  She decided to join this year because she really wanted to earn enough to feed her family. 

Even though she is new to the program, Annah wanted to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Annah hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 11 solar lights; even though Annah decided not to, some farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package."

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Cherise

texts.en:
Four months ago, Cherise became a book publisher. She says, “Someone opened the door for me to become an author and I want to do the same for someone else.”  Her business, Purple Diamond Publishing, supports Cherise and her son. Cherise says, “Purple Diamond Publishing helps up and coming authors who do not have the financial means to publish their own books. They will have editing services, publishing services, and cover design that will help drive their sales into the status of becoming financially stable.”

Even though Cherise’s business is young, she has already gotten noticed by literary agents and hopes to have a major publisher back her business in the future. In the meantime, she needs a loan to purchases editing software and an updated computer.

loans.use: to puchase editing software and an updated computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: o purchase books and stationary for her husband's stationery shop.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Norma has been in this business for 4 years. Norma earns additional income from a general store.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40 year old married lady. She lives with her six children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking loan for her husband who owns an embroidery shop. He has been selling embroidery raw material and supplies for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive but its turnover very high. 

Due to high costs he is facing a shortage of material and is unable to purchase expensive raw materials to sell. Therefore, Naseem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can overcome his shortage of embroidery material. Through this amount he will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors. 

Naseem is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for reselling.

loans.name: Ephel's Group

texts.en:
Ephel's Group is formed by 8 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Ephel, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 50 years old, is married and has 4 children. Ephel has been a farmer for 4 years and is often referred to as a very hard-working individual.

Ephel isn’t new to One Acre Fund, she actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year, Ephel will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Ephel's Group will purchase a total of 9 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary una empresaria de 36 años de edad madre de 4 hijos, tres varones de 18, 17, 9 y la menor una niña de 6 años de edad, estos niños son la razón de ser de esta mujer, se levanta por ellos,  quiere que estudien, que sean personas que aporten cosas buenas a la sociedad.
Gracias a su negocio de venta de madera ha podido a ayudar a su pareja con los gastos que implican 4 hijos y los gatos del hogar  y sus propósitos para este fin de año son poder darle una educación universitaria a los mayores y unos lindos traídos de navidad a los menores.
Por tal razón solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía que sería madera de varios tipos, ya que ella surte a diferentes carpinteros de la zona y personas varias que necesitan de este producto.
texts.en: Mary is 36 years old and the mother of 4 children; three boys who are 18, 17 and 9 years old and a daughter who is 6 years old. Her children are her everything and all that she does, she does for them. She wants them to go to school and to be good members of the community who give back to society. Thanks to her business selling wood, she has been able to help her husband with the cost of raising four children and other household expenses. Her goal for the end of the year is to be able to provide a college education for her older children and to purchase Christmas outfits for the younger ones. And so, she is asking for a loan that she will use to purchase merchandise that includes a variety of woods that she supplies to local carpenters and to others who need her product.

loans.use: purchase wood to stock her business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
With her first Kiva loan, Hellen stocked her shop with quality clothes that she ordered from outside of the country. This gave her a competitive advantage, as she was the only at the market with these different types of clothes. Due to the increase in sales, she has been able to become an independent woman who can support her family and send her two cousins and her child to school.

She hopes to receive a bigger loan so that she can expand into another busy market that is available. In the future as her business grows and becomes even more profitable, Hellen wants to venture into farming and raise money to further her studies and send her children to a better school. She also dreams of building her own house in the township so that she can move out of her parents’ home.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Before receiving her first loan from Kiva, Sylvia was rearing chickens from her spare bedroom. Even though she was passionate about her business, the room's capacity was not only insufficient, it also did not provide a proper environment for the chickens. 

However, after Sylvia received her Kiva loan the business improved dramatically. She managed to build a fowl run with a capacity for more than 150 birds, and now she produces over 100 birds each cycle. 

Despite the major improvements in Sylvia's business, there has been increased poultry farming competition at the market. As a result, she has not been earning the anticipated profits. Nevertheless, Sylvia was able to refurbish her house and pay for both of her children's tuition fees. 

As a successful businesswoman in her community, Sylvia feels that the Kiva loan has gone a long way in improving her status and the way her husband perceives her. 

In the future, Sylvia would love to diversify into gardening because she sees a lot of potential in healthy, natural products. Sylvia also hopes to further her eduction by pursuing her bachelor’s degree in Zimbabwe.

loans.use: to purchase chick feed and increase her poultry production.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha's first loan had a great impact on her business of poultry. Her business improved from 120 birds every six weeks to 100 every three weeks. This improved her income dramatically. She has expanded her business and is also doing complimentary projects of buying and selling clothes for the upkeep of her family. She bought clothes for herself and renovated her mother’s house. Martha has been paying fees for her further education. She is looking forward to running her own butchery shop, purchasing a car and enrolling at a college to train as a teacher. Martha would love to have a second loan to increase production.

loans.use: to grow her business by buying more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en: Miguel is married and his wife takes care of their home. He has two children, both of them are currently studying. Miguel works as a carpenter. He is a man dedicated to his family and job and is always looking for new opportunities. They live in a town nearby. Miguel takes care of his mother and she recently developed a vision problem, which is affecting both of her eyes and she is unable to see from a far distance. Due to economic reasons she was unable to pay for the surgery. Miguel decided to use this loan to have the eye surgery performed.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is single and lives with her parents. She currently works as a teacher. She had to change glasses constantly because they detected her with a vision problem to see from far distance,. They suggested her to have surgery performed to correct her vision problem, but due to economic reasons she could not have the surgery performed.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Malititi  -  Masaka Bimbilla Group

texts.en:
Safura is a hardworking 57-year-old woman from Bimbilla in the northern region of Ghana. She is married and has 6 children. Safura is the individual pictured with her hands on the shea nuts among the group members who are squatting.

Safura is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the last 12 years. The name of the group is "Malititi - Masaka Bimbilla." Safura earns a good profit from the business as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their shea butter processing business such that they can always produce premium quality for the local markets around Bimbilla and non-local markets.

Safura and "Malititi - Masaka Bimbilla" have asked for a loan of GHS 17,750.00. Safura’s share of the loan is GHS 400.00 which will be used to buy shea nuts for processing. Safura aspires to earn more income as well as to repay this loan and support her family with food and educational materials.

Safura thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married, lives with his wife and two of his daughters. He has worked as a security guard in a private school for the past 18 years. He works hard to support his family. For a few years he has had difficulty locating objects from far distance and is now affecting him in his job function. The only option he has is to have surgery to correct his vision problem. Due to economic reasons in the past the surgery could not be performed. He is using this loan to pay for the eye surgery.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is divorced. He has two children and works as a teacher, lives with his mother and takes care of her. He is very responsible and dedicated to his family.  Since he was 20 years old he was diagnosed with myopia (near sightedness) he cannot distinguish far sight objects and is now becoming difficult for him to see near sight objects as well. He's been wearing glasses for quite some time now. He wants to have surgery done because it's really uncomfortable for him to perform his daily activities. He is using this loan for his eye surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.en: Maria de Jesus is married and currently lives with her husband and three children. She's currently employed in a company were she had a couple of work related accidents. A few months ago she was diagnosed with an eye retina problem and needs surgery. Due to economic reasons in the past, she was not able to have the surgery performed. She is using this loan to have the eye surgery performed.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат 56 лет. Она умная и трудолюбивая женщина, проживающая в городе Худжанд, на севере Таджикистана. Каромат занимается своим любимым делом - она шьет женские платья на заказ. Это ремесло она унаследовала от матери еще в юности. Однако она начала свой швейный бизнес три года назад. В этой деятельности ей помогает невестка, которая живет вместе с сыном Каромат в ее доме. Каромат сейчас хочет расширить свой швейный бизнес и купить еще одну швейную машинку, а также необходимое количество тканей. Кредит позволит Каромат больше брать заказы и увеличить прибыльность дела. В будущем она планирует еще больше развиваться и открыть собственный швейный цех. Помогите реализовать планы Каромат.
texts.en: Karomat is 56 years old. She is a smart and hardworking woman, living in the town of Khujand, in the north of Tajikistan. Karomat is involved in her favorite occupation - she sews women's dresses to-order. She inherited this trade in her youth from her mother; however, she started her own sewing business three years ago. Her daughter-in-law, who lives with Karomat's son in her house, helps her with this business. Now Karomat wants to expand her sewing business and buy another sewing machine and also a necessary quantity of fabrics. The loan will allow Karomat to accept more orders and increase her business profitability. In the future, she plans to grow her business more and open her own sewing shop. Please help Karomat realize her plans.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and fabrics in order to expand her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 61-year-old energetic and a hardworking mother of three children. She is from the Thika area of Kenya. Rose is very hardworking, and she always says, “My parents taught me to work hard from a very young age, and now I am independent.” 

Rose is very dedicated, and she does mixed farming and some small business to supplement her income. She makes sure that she gives the best to her three children so that they can be productive in the future and support themselves. 

Rose enjoys farming, especially milking and grazing her dairy cows. Rose has farmed for 20 years, and is recognized as one of the best farmers in her village. Because of this, most villagers want products from her farm. This has increased her profits. Although she enjoys selling her products to the nearby market and to neighbors, her income is not sufficient to enable her to comfortably take care of her family. 

Therefore, she plans to start a poultry farm. Rose requests 40,000 KES to start a poultry farm to improve her income. The Thika area is a populated area, and there is a market for eggs and poultry products, but the supply is low. Rose plans to take advantage of that and reap more profits. 

Rose has been trained by Juhudi Kilimo, and is financially disciplined. She believes that she will be able to repay the loan and open other business ventures. 

If you are a mother from Africa, getting your hands on financial services is difficult, but Rose is sure that through your kindness, she will be able to acquire the loan, help her family, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Salvacion works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and other food vending. Salvacion is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
WONDERFUL LENDERS! Meet Jackline, from the Litein area of Kenya, which is a cosmopolitan town where most of the people are very hardworking small-scale farmers. Jackline is 21 years old and the proud mother of one child. Jackline can be described as very hardworking because filling her family's and her siblings' stomachs is not easy. However, she has managed to pull through and has always put food on the table for this large family. 

Jackline practices mixed farming to make ends meet and, through animal and crop farming, she has been able to get more profits. Jackline sells the fruits of her labor at the nearby market and has been able to build a large customer base. Jackline has been practicing farming for the past five years and has gained a wealth of experience. She has been able to face good times and bad times in farming. 

Although Jackline makes profits, she still faces the challenges of feeding her large family, and so she wants to start a poultry business. Jackline is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 to buy poultry and to be able to increase her income levels. Through increased income levels, Jackline will be sure that her child and siblings will get a good education and be able to have a brighter future.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
HELLO!  Meet Margaret, 40 years of age. She is very ambitious and enterprising, and a go-getting woman who hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is a proud mother and has been doing mixed farming for the past fifteen years. Her primary sources of income are egg selling, crop selling, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. Margaret loves farming and has even nicknamed her cow and she really takes good care of her dairy cows. The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions that favor horticulture farming; that is, good soils, good climate, a good transport system and a ready market for horticulture products. Margaret wants to take advantage and start horticultural farming. She is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. She intends to buy good vegetable and fruits seeds that she will use in horticultural farming 

With more income she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. The financial benefits that Margaret will reap are almost immediate, and hence she will be assured of a secure future. She plans to start exporting her horticulture to international markets once she has accumulated more profits

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a 42-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Eldoret, which is an agricultural center near the famous Rift valley. She owns a small piece of land together with her lovely 53-year-old husband, and they have been blessed with  children. 

On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for 20 years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a farm-produce-motorcycle-transportation business. 

From Kiva lenders, Leah is seeking a loan worth KES 120,000 to grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident from the steadily rising exports. 

While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to provide Leah with access to a loan facility that will assist her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, Leah’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Fridah, 27 years of age. She is a very dedicated and hard-working woman. She resides in the Chuka area of Kenya. She has one lovely and adorable school-going child whom she really values and treasures. She always refers to him as "her heartbeat." Fridah has been practicing farming for the past four years and, through hard work and determination, she has been able to support her family and always provide a plate of food for them. Her main sources of income are milk, poultry, crops and some small personal business that she does to make ends meet. 

Because of harsh living conditions and the lack of employment, Fridah plans to increase her farming output so that she can improve her income and, hence, her living conditions. That is why she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES to buy farm inputs. Through buying farming inputs, such as good-quality seeds and good fertilizer and pesticide, she will be able to increase her crop output and, hence, improve her income. Fridah is very visionary and enterprising and she hopes that, through improved income, she will be able to save more money. She plans to buy more land and increase her farming in the future. Through this loan, her business will continue to flourish and she will assure her school-going child of uninterrupted learning because she will pay tuition fees on time and also improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticultural farm.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Dinah. She is a 26-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley of Kenya. Dinah and her husband are blessed to have four children. Dinah has been a mixed-farmer for more than four years. She keeps dairy cows, poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables to sell. She also holds a day job and engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Dinah is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya.

Dinah is seeking a loan to grow her horticultural farm. This move is quite a big deal for her. With your loan, Dinah seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops, but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kapsowar and other parts of the country is very high. Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: To grow her horticultural farming business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet Susan, one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 38 years of age and ambitious. Susan hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya, a place known as the “mango region” of Kenya since half of the mangoes that Kenya exports are from this area. 

Susan has been farming for the past 10 years, and she has gathered an immense wealth of experience over those years. Because of all her experience, she offers free advice to young and new farmers, and also extends services to her neighbors. 

Susan practices mixed farming, and through her ventures she has been able to reap greater profits. But she has not yet reached her maximum potential. 

Susan sells vegetables and milk to the nearest market, which is nonetheless far from where she lives, making it a challenge to transport her products there. Her village is not only remote, the infrastructure is also very poor. Susan deals with perishable goods, and therefore she needs to deliver them to the market as quickly as possible. However, the poor roads make this difficult, and her products reach the market very late. They arrive no longer fresh and, hence, fetch a low price. 

This is why Susan is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES. With this loan, Susan will be able to purchase a motorbike which will assist her in delivering her products to the market quickly. Susan is sure that, through the timely delivery of her products, she will earn a maximum profit and be able to support her children and family. 

Susan's dream is to continue cultivating her land and selling more produce to the market so that her family will lack nothing. Through the profits she earns Susan will be able to both repay the loan on time and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Pedro Manuel

texts.es:
Pedro es un empresario de 32 años de edad, responsable, atento muy cordial con un negocio de tienda general y una gran responsabilidad ser la única tienda del sector, Pedro tiene que tener gran surtido para satisfacer y surtir a la variedad de clientes, sin olvidar que todo el capital no lo puede invertir en la empresa pues es padre y responsable de una familia que igual tienen muchos gastos.
Pedro en el momento necesita un apoyo económico para comprar variedad de surtido en granos y víveres y abarrotes que son los productos de mayor movimiento.
Ya que no tiene el capital para pagar la cantidad que necesita recurre al crédito y sus grandes ventajas es que podrá recoger capital para una próxima inversión, mantendrá la fidelidad de los clientes, y sus ventas seguirán prosperando para lograr una estabilidad que le permita comprar una casa propia claro a cuotas.
texts.en:
Pedro is 32 years old, responsible, and very courteous in his report with customers in his general store. Running his store is a big responsibility because it is the only one of its kind in the area. Pedro needs to keep the store stocked in order to satisfy customer demand. But he needs to balance the financial demands of his work and home life because he is also a father and responsible for his family.

Pedro needs some financial help so he can purchase supplies like grains and groceries but he doesn't have the liquid capital to do so. And so he is asking for a loan so he can purchase what the store needs and maintain his customer's loyalty. His sales will continue to grow and give him enough economic stability to purchase a home.

loans.use: purchase supplies like grains and groceries.

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily is a 44-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She is representing her group of 10 farmers in the Kakamega North district. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Emily has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Emily described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during the dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Emily’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To major in market gardening and venture into peanut butter production.

loans.name: Harun's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Harun, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. She is 35 years old and, as a group leader, she is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega North District, Kenya.  She is married and has three children.

Harun is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that she is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why she decided to join in the first place. Harun says that she is happy to have made that decision because, since she first joined in 2012, she has been able to consistently feed her family, which has improved her day-to-day life significantly. Harun will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.75 acres. Given that some members will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is single and lives with his family. He has a part time job, and he works and studies at the same time. He works hard to support his family. He developed a hereditary cornea problem that affects him to focus on near and far sight objects which is really bothering him because he's having frequent headaches and pain in the eyes. The only option for him is to have surgery, but due to the high cost he couldn't have the surgery done in the past. He is using this loan to have the eye surgery performed.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is a widower and lives with two daughters. Her husband past away a few years ago. She is retired and economically depends on her daughters. She suffers from cataracts in the eyes, which is really common. This eye problem has been affecting her vision for quite some time. She has been using glasses for a very long time, and now it has become uncomfortable for her. Recently she went to have a vision exam, and she was a good candidate to have the surgery done to correct her vision problem. She is using this loan to have the eye surgery performed.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Karfa

texts.fr:
Âgé de 31 ans, Karfa, est tôlier et exerce le métier depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est marié et père d’une petite fille d’un an et demi. Karfa vit en famille et se partage la dépense quotidienne de la famille avec ses frères : ce qui peut lui revenir à 25 000f par mois.
Il vient solliciter pour la première fois un crédit de 250 000f afin de pouvoir réparer sa voiture panne de moteur. Avec ce véhicule, il pourra avoir des revenus supplémentaires pour faire face à ses charges aussi bien professionnelles que familiales.
Karfa rêve de développer son activité, il aimerait créer une entreprise où tous les besoins du véhicule seront pris en compte : tôlerie, peinture, mécanique, électricité. Un client qui vient réviser son véhicule trouvera tout sur place. Karfa rêve aussi de développer le transport et d’acquérir un autre véhicule.
texts.en:
Aged 31, Karfa has been a metal worker for over ten years. He is married and father to an 18-month girl. He lives with his family, sharing the family's daily expenses with his brothers. This comes up to about 25,000 XOF per month.

He is requesting a loan for the first time. The amount, 250,000 XOF, will allow him to repair his car’s motor. With the vehicle, he can generate additional revenues that help him pay for his professional and familial expenses.

Karfa dreams of growing his business. He would like to create a company where a client’s every car needs will be met: body, paint, mechanics, and electrical issues. A client coming for an inspection would find everything available. Karfa also dreams of growing his transportation business and to buy another vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his 205 car

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is a 46-year-old married father of six children living in Kasese Uganda. A farmer who produces fruits, vegetables, and nursery beds for trees, Ivan sells his products by winning tenders. He has a dream of becoming rich but faces the challenges of weather changes and thieves.

Ivan used his previous loan to buy loam soil for his nursery beds. He is now requesting a new loan to buy coffee seeds and porting bags.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds and porting bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy covering and overlock sewing machines, as a man displaced by violence who is trying to get ahead in the city.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Yairipok Munugol Group

texts.en:
