Jano is a down-to-earth person who sells and supplies rice in the market to support her family. She is the featured borrower of the group and is pictured with her hand raised. Her husband is a farmer and works in the paddy field for sustenance. They live in a joint family with her sons and daughters-in-law and grandchildren. Both the sons are working. One serves in the army, while the other works in a private sector outside the state to generate income.

Jano has been in the rice business for the past several years. She buys rice grains at a cheaper rate from the villagers and grinds the grains at the village rice mill. She sells the milled rice grains at the market for a small profit, and sometimes people come to buy rice at her place. The profit she makes from selling the rice is used in maintaining the household expenses.

Since they live in a joint family, the household expenses are high, and their household income can hardly meet to their needs. Sometimes they do not get adequate income for the household. Considering their financial condition, Jano wanted to improve her business by selling more varieties of rice so that she could generate more income adequate for the household.

With the Kiva loan, she will buy stock of rice grains from her village neighbours and sell the milled rice at the market. She hopes for a successful business so that she can generate a sufficient amount of income for her family. She also wishes good luck to the lenders for their endeavours in the future.

The entire group members are engaged in selling rice as their main source of income. They are all enthusiastic in their endeavours and strive to become successful in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice to mill and then sell in the market.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is the 57-year-old proud mother of 10 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual.  She is representing her group of 14 farmers in Webuye District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Rose has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Rose described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize.  She will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Rose’s group will be able to plant a total of 9.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married and has two daughters who are married and independent. He lives with his wife, and he continues to work even though he's retired. He has developed a vision problem that is affecting his daily life activities due to the fact that his vision problem got him incapacitated and could not have the surgery due to financial reasons. Recently he went to have a vision exam, and he was a good candidate to have the surgery done to correct his vision problem. He is using this loan to pay for the eye surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is single and currently lives with his brother. He has been working in a construction company for a few years now. His father past away a few years ago. He started to develop vision problems, and it got to the point where it started to affect his job duties, and he was therefore disabled for some time. He currently helps his mother financially, and for this reason had been unable to get the surgery done. Recently he and his brother went to have the vision exam in order to have the surgery performed. He is using this loan to pay his eye surgery.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is married and works in a mechanic shop as a receptionist. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman. Her husband decided to take her to get a vision exam. While in the eye exam they found out that she has developed a hereditary cornea problem that affects her to focus on near and far sight objects which is really bothering her because she's having frequent headaches and pain in the eyes. The only option for her is to have an eye surgery, but due to the high cost she couldn't have the surgery done in the past. She is using this loan to have the eye surgery performed.

loans.use: To have an eye surgery

loans.name: Dado

texts.fr:
Mère Dado, est une ancienne cliente de l’IMCEC qui a bénéficié de deux crédits. Elle est mariée et mère de trois filles dont l’une lui a été confiée par sa grande sœur. Elles sont âgées respectivement de 25 et 21 ans. Dado évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 25 ans, activité qui consiste à vendre de l’encens et divers autres produits. Pour ce crédit, elle envisage d’acheter des habits pour enfants (body, jeans, bas…) pour revendre. 
La dame Dado est prise en compte par son époux, elle n’a aucune charge et s’évertue à construire petit à petit sa maison qui un jour appartiendra à ses filles qu’elle veut mettre à l’abri du besoin.
texts.en:
Mother Dado is an old client of IMCEC; she has benefited from two loans. She is married and a mother of three daughters, one of which was entrusted to her by her older sister. Her daughters are 25 and 21 years old.

Dado has worked in retail for over 25 years; her business consists in selling incense and other various products. For this loan, she is planning on purchasing children’s clothing (onesies, jeans, bottoms…) to resell.

Mrs. Dado is supported by her husband, she has no fixed expenses and is striving to build her house little by little, one day to leave it to her daughters and free them from want.

loans.use: to buy children clothing and incense.

loans.name: Mame Cor

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mame Cor est chauffeur depuis 2006, ayant obtenu 3 ans auparavant, son permis de conduire, il a du être au service d’un particulier depuis 7 ans. Il a récemment acheté un véhicule avec ses économies. Cependant il vient solliciter un crédit afin de pouvoir faire la mutation des papiers à son nom et de refaire la tôlerie.
Mame Cor est marié et père de trois enfants, dont l’ainée, âgée de 7 ans et le cadet, un garçon de 3 ans. Mame Cor travaille selon ses propres horaires : il peut passer même toute la nuit à conduire. 
Puisqu’il ne connait que le transport, il a comme souhait de développer cette activité et d’acquérir d’autres véhicules dans la mesure du possible.
texts.en:
Mister Mame Cor has been a driver since 2006, three years after getting his driver’s license. For the past seven years, he had to work for a private client. Recently, he purchased a vehicle with his savings. He is however requesting a loan to get the paperwork transferred in his name and to get the car exterior’s redone.
 

Mame Cor is married and a father of three: his eldest is a seven-year-old girl, his youngest a three-year-old boy. He works on his own schedule; sometimes he even spends the entire night driving.

Since driving is all he knows, he wishes to grow this business and to buy other vehicles when possible.

loans.use: to get work auto body work done on his car and to register the vehicle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, who is 44 years old and single, hails from Mayorga, Leyte.  

She operates a sari-sari (or variety) store. She sells items like cooking oil, toothpaste, shampoo, eggs, sugar, canned goods, and soft drinks. 

She has been operating a store for ten years now. To have additional income, Teresita engages in food vending, selling shakoy (which are fried twisted doughnuts dipped in a bowl of sugar).

She is in need of capital to continue operate her existing business. Teresita has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 PHP to buy additional stocks like beverages, noodles, and canned goods and to provide capital for food vending. This will fill her store with various stocks and at the same time increase the production of her food vending, too. 

Teresita will be able to afford to buy nutritious diets that are essential in her day to day activity.  She would like to expand both businesses to be successful and help improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy stocks like beverages, noodles, and canned goods and obtain capital for food vending

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
Judith's group is formed by 11 farmers in Butere District.  It is being represented by Judith, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 51 years old, is married, and has four children. Judith has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Judith isn’t new to One Acre Fund.  She joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. 

This year, Judith will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase two solar lights. She is very excited about this addition.  Now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Judith's group will purchase a total of 13 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is the 66-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of eight farmers in Webuye District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Florence has noticed that she has learned a lot from farming trainings. Florence described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

She is very excited also to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize.  She will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Florence’s group will be able to plant a total of 3 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Editor

texts.en:
Editor is 34 years old, married with three children, living in Kasese in Uganda. 

Editor is a community development officer, and she also practices farming and owns rentals to earn extra income. 

She was inspired by the youth to serve the community, a service she has rendered for four years. She has a dream of going for further studies, even though she is faced with the challenge of heavy work load. 

Editor wants money to buy bricks and cement to construct her family house.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to build her family house.

loans.name: Sandra Mireya

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 41 años de edad, es madre y esposa, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego  la falta de recursos económicos la llevó a trabajar desde muy pequeña para poder sustentar sus necesidades. Ahora Sandra vive con sus hijos y el esposo en la ciudad de Latacunga perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador. 
Sandra se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artículos de cuero junto a su esposo ha logrado salir adelante en su hogar y su negocio que cada día crece más y más, esta actividad lo aprendió de sus padres  quienes le ayudaron con esta idea, y esto ha servido para sacar a su familia adelante,  sus ventas las realiza en la ciudad y fuera de ella. Sandra dedica a esta actividad desde 8 a 10 horas cada día paralelamente con las actividades del hogar que incluyen el cuidado de sus hijos, su pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo cada día más y ahora se siente preparada para dar un paso de crecimiento para lo cual solicita un crédito que lo utilizará en la compra de materiales ya que necesita entregar unos pedidos 
Además  le gustaría en el futuro comprarse un vehículo que le permita llegar a más clientes que demandan el producto y  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 41-year-old woman. She is a wife and mother, and thanks to her parents' efforts, she was able to finish primary school. Later, because of the lack of economic resources, she had to work starting at a very young age in order to supply her needs. Today, Sandra lives with her husband and children in the city of Latacunga, which belongs to the province of Cotopaxi in the Republic of Ecuador. 

Sandra works making and selling leather articles. Together with her husband, she has been able to get ahead with her household and her business, which is growing more and more every day. She learned this work from her parents, who helped her with this idea, and it has served to support her family. She sells her products both inside and outside the city. Sandra dedicates herself to this work from 8 to 10 hours every day, in conjunction with her household chores, which include caring for her children. Her small business has been growing day by day, and she now feels prepared to take a step in growth. For that reason she is requesting a loan which she will use to buy materials, since she needs to fulfill some orders. 

In addition, in the future she would like to buy a vehicle which will allow her to reach more customers who want her products. She is grateful to the Alternativa Foundation in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible this growth in her professional and personal life.

loans.use: to buy materials to make her products, thus increasing her sales and supporting her husband in providing a better future for their children.

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr:
Malick, marié et père de 4 enfants dont l’ainé, âgé de 21 ans et la plus petite, de 3 ans. Malick s’active dans le transport, il a démarré en 1990 et conduit le véhicule de son frère absent du pays. Dès 7h du matin, Malick démarre sa journée et peut aller jusqu’à 21h avant de rentrer se reposer. Il tire sa dépense quotidienne des recettes du taxi, mais participe aussi à la popote familiale. 
Malick vient pour la première fois solliciter ce montant afin d’effectuer quelques réparations sur le véhicule. Seulement avec l’ambition qu’il nourrit, qui est celle d’acquérir son propre véhicule et de pouvoir maximiser son profit, il compte renouveler cette transaction.
texts.en:
Malick is married and a father of four. His oldest is a 21-year-old son, his youngest a three-year-old daughter.

Malick work in transportation. He started in 1990, and drives his brother’s car, since his brother is out of the country. Malick starts his day at 7 a.m. and can go on until 9 p.m. before he goes home to rest. The taxi covers his daily expenses and allows him to contribute to the household’s expenses.

Malick is requesting his first loan to get some repairs done to the car. Given his ambition to buy his own vehicle to maximize his profit, he is planning on reiterating this transaction.

loans.use: to fix his taxi.

loans.name: Ubumenyi Group

texts.fr:
Graciose  fait partie du groupe  Ubumenyi  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 37 ans et est marié  àSeliso ,un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 4 à 15 ans, dont  2 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de  farine de manioc,  depuis  20 ans. 

Elle  est à son douzième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de kilos de farine  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  acheter  des lopins de terre et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Graciose belongs to group Ubumenyi and lives in Gitega. She is 37 years old and married to Seliso, a farmer. Together they have three children between the ages of four and fifteen. Two of them go to school.

She has been selling manioc flour for twenty years. This is her twelfth loan with Turame. With the loan granted through Kiva, she will increase her capital and purchase many kilos of flour to retail to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy plots of land and see her children study.

loans.use: she will increase her capital and buy many kilos of flour to retail and earn more.

loans.name: Dennys Fabricio

texts.es:
Dennys  es un joven ecuatoriano  de 21 años de edad , es soltero vive en casa de su  abuela junto con su madre y hermano su padre los abandonó desde hace mucho tiempo, por  referencia de un familiar  y cliente de Fundacion Alternativa solicitó un crédito, el mismo que lo utilizó para invertir en mas producto ya que las ventas aumentaron y tiene pedidos pendientes por entregar. Hoy está en su segundo crédito el que será utilizado en la compra de mas productos.
Es soltero actualmente está estudiando en la ESPE  Latacunga se encuentra cursando el segundo semestre de Ingeniería Petroquímica, es muy buen estudiante y muy emprendedor con su trabajo ayuda a su madre en los gastos de la familia.  Su pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez más, se dedica a la venta de productos naturales,  A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, Dennys es muy responsable en sus estudios y colaborador en su hogar.
La zona donde vive es muy comercial y es una zona urbana está ubicada en pleno centro de la ciudad.
Quiere agradecer a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Dennys is a young Ecuadorian, 21 years of age. He is single and lives in his grandmother's home together with his mother and brother. His father abandoned them a long time ago. On the reference of a family member and client of the Alternativa Foundation, he requested a loan, which he used to invest in more products, since his sales have increased and he has pending orders to deliver. He is currently on his second loan, which will be used to buy more products. 

He is single and currently a student at ESPE Latacunga, where he is in his second semester of Petrochemical Engineering. He is a very good student and very enterprising. With his work, he helps his mother with the family expenses. His little business has been gradually growing. He works selling natural products. In spite of having work that demands a lot of time and effort, Dennys is very responsible in his studies and helpful in his household.

The area where he lives is very commercial, and it is an urban zone, located in the very center of the city. 

He would like to thank the Alternativa Foundation in Ecuador and Kiva for making possible this growth in his professional and personal life.

loans.use: to purchase more products and supplies.

loans.name: Principe De Dios Group

texts.es: Príncipe de Dios es un grupo solidario integrado por personas laboriosas y emprendedoras conformado por Azucena de 37 años de edad, casada y propietaria de una pulpería en su comunidad desde hace ocho años, lo cual solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, jugos, granos básicos, leches, quesos, verduras, frutas, carne, pollo, etc. La segunda socia es la señora Yaritza de 26 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de fritanga y cosméticos y don José tiene la edad de 53 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarras en su localidad.
texts.en:
Príncipe de Dios [Prince of God] is a solidarity group made up of hardworking and entrepreneurial people. One member is 37-year-old Azucena, married and owner of a convenience store in her community for the past eight years. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of soda, juice, staple grains, milk, cheese, vegetables, fruit, meat, chicken, etc.

The second member is 26-year-old Señora Yaritza who makes a living selling fried food and cosmetics, and Don José is 53 years old and makes a living purchasing and selling scrap metal in his town.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice, staple grains, milk, cheese, vegetables, fruit, meat, chicken, etc. and increase sales.

loans.name: Cecilia Azucena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza.
En este lugar vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 40 años de edad mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos de 20, 17, 13 y 6 años, dos de ellos estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela Su marido es comerciante.
Doña Cecilia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudar a mantener el hogar, ella  tiene una tienda de víveres donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como aceite, arroz, detergentes, carne, pescado, queso, así como también productos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Los mismos que  vende en su local o puerta a puerta recorriendo la ciudad, con estas ventas se gana algo extra que les sirve para salir adelante ya que su marido a veces no gana mucho, ella tiene más de 20 años con este negocio.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para surtir aun más su tienda y productos Yanbal. Lleva 12 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños son aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Anna, known for its beautiful landscapes and its lovely hot springs of sweet water, much visited by tourists, the “New Hope” Credit Group meets every 15 days.

In this place Cecilia resides. She is 40 years old, lives in a common law union, and has four children, ages 20, 17, 13, and 6. Two of them study in a 'colegio' and the youngest attends public school. Her husband is a merchant.

Cecilia is a woman who likes to work in order to support the home. She has a grocery store that sells all kinds of products of primary necessity, such as cooking oil, rice, detergents, meat, fish, and cheese, plus Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and ladies accessories). Cecilia sells these in her store and door to door, walking about the city. With these sales, Cecilia earns something extra which helps them get ahead, since her husband, at times, doesn't earn much. She has had her business for more than 20 years.

Cecilia will use this loan to purchase groceries to better stock her store and renew her supply of Yanbal products. She has belonged to the Credit Group for 12 years and she likes it for the benefits she receives from the institution. Cecilia dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and Yanbal products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: creams, lotions, shampoo, soap, makeup, mascara for eyelashes, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza.
En este lugar vive la señora Yolanda, tiene 42 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció  pero de esa relación tiene un hijo de 21 años el cual trabaja de ayudante de albañilería y vive con ella.
Doña Yolanda es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así salir adelante y más aun después de la muerte de su esposo, ella  se dedica al comercio, compra y vende carne e hígado al por mayor y menor, vende en su casa y también entrega a domicilio, la carne ella la muele y luego esta carne molida la lleva a entregar a ciertos locales donde venden hamburguesas, su hijo le ayuda en esta labor, lleva más de 12 años en este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante a punta de su trabajo duro pero honrado.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar carne e hígado. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los otros créditos que ofrece la institución.  Sus sueños es seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en: The members of the Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) community bank meet every fortnight in the city of Santa Ana, well-known for its beautiful scenery and its wonderful freshwater springs which are very popular with tourists. The city is home to 42 year old Yolanda, whose husband passed away some years ago leaving her to raise their son who still lives at home with her. Her son is now 21 years old and working as a builder's helper. Yolanda is the kind of person who works hard at getting ahead and even more so since her husband died. She runs a business buying and selling meat and liver, both in wholesale and smaller quantities. She sells her wares from her home and she also provides a home delivery service. She grinds the meat herself to make mince which she then delivers to certain establishments that sell hamburgers. Her son helps her out with the business which, despite being difficult but honourable work, she has been running for the last 12 years and it has allowed her to progress in her life. She will use this loan to buy meat and liver. She has been a member of this Community Bank for the last 5 years and she is grateful for the others loans which she has had previously. Her aim for the future is to continue improving her business.

loans.use: Comprar carne e hígado.

loans.name: Sashi Kala

texts.en:
Sashi Kala lives in Orvakal, Kurnool, Andhra Pradessh, with her husband and son. Her son is studying in third grade. Sashi Kala is a farmer. She works on her own land and also works as a daily-wage worker in agriculture fields. Her husband is a mason. Both husband and wife work hard to improve their lives, as their income is not adequate to maintain the family.

Sashi Kala cultivates tomatoes, red gram, Bengal gram, etc. She is now requesting a loan from Kiva to improve her agriculture farm, which will help her to improve her income by getting a high yield. With the loan, she will buy quality seeds and fertilizers.

She wants to save for her son’s education. She is thankful for this loan, for it realizes her family's needs for additional capital for cultivation. She hopes to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mayssaa

texts.en:
Mayssaa is a 42 year old mother of three who owns a grocery store inside a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. After growing up with her parents under extremely unstable socio-economic conditions inside the camp, Mayssaa is now raising her children in a similar setting, her husband's contribution to the family expenses being very modest. 
Determined to provide her children with decent living conditions, Mayssaa opened her own grocery store two and a half years ago, in which she sells refreshment drinks, cleaning products, candies and food products. 
She is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. The loan will allow her to increase her supplies which will boost her sales and monthly income from the store.

loans.use: to increase her grocery store's stocks

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 35 year old Palestinian photographer who was born and raised in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. She is single and lives alone in an apartment she is renting inside the camp. 
Rima's passion for photography led her to establish her own photography studio as a home-based business after 10 years of working as a free lancer on different projects. 
She is asking for a  515,872 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa and is planning on using it to upgrade her studio's decor. The loan will allow her to attract more customers and start expanding her business which has been her ambition for a long time.

loans.use: to upgrade her studio's decor

loans.name: Lisandro

texts.es:
Lisandro un joven de 23 años de edad, lleno de sueños, Ganas de trabajar de cambiar la imagen de los campesinos frente a todos, de demostrarle que ellos pueden salir adelante, pueden estudiar, pueden ser grandes empresarios.
Desde temprana edad este joven mostro las ganas de salir adelante y gracias a su pasión por el trabajo y las enseñanzas de su padre tiene un negocio de cría de ganado, es pocas palabras es productor de leche.
Lisandro solicita un considerable crédito para la compra de dos vacas lecheras, la razón del monto es que las vacas las tiene que comprar preñadas para poder que den leche, con sus respectivas vacunas.
Apoyen a este emprendedor que solo quiere triunfar y trabajar.
texts.en:
Lisandro, 23, is a young man with a lot of dreams and a desire to work.  He wants to change everyone's image of farmworkers, to show them that they can get ahead, they can study, they can be great entrepreneurs.

This young man showed a desire to get ahead from a young age.  Thanks to his passion for the job and his father's lessons, he has a business raising cattle.  In short, he produces milk.

Lisandro's requesting a considerable loan to buy two dairy cows.  The reason for the amount is that he has to buy the cows pregnant, and with their corresponding vaccines, so they'll give milk.

Help this entrepreneur who only wants to work and succeed.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.  He's a young man looking for support so he can be independent and always help his family.

loans.name: Nhóm 04_Thôn Đô Trang_Dân Lực Group

texts.en:
Ms. Phấn operates a food stall selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase meat to resell.

Phấn is 52 years old and she is single with two children.
Phấn is the group leader of the Nhóm 04_Thôn Đô Trang_Dân Lực  solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is Phấn first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Phấn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Phấn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phấn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase meat to resell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a soy sauce vendor from Leyte, Philippines. She is 32 years old and a mother of four children. She also sells dry goods like clothes, slippers and sandals and other items.
 
Anita is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like ready-to-wear clothes, sandals, slippers,and more stocks for her  soy sauce. This loan will enable her to improve her stock, allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Anita hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like ready-to-wear clothes, sandals, slippers and more stock for her patis or fish sauce

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a resident of Iloilo, Philippines. She is 52 years old and is engaged in fishing together with her husband.

Margarita has been in this business for 28 years now. This is the one business she knows best and she wants to take care of it. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy a boat propeller, rope, fishing nets and fishing weights.

She is determined to work hard in order to succeed in fishing, pay her loan dues and improve her home. In the future, she hopes to have enough savings and to live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy a boat propeller, rope, fishing nets and fishing weights

loans.name: Nhóm 01_Thôn 5_Minh Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Thu is 33 years old, and she is married with two children. Thu is the group leader of the Nhóm 01_Thôn 5_Minh Châu  solidarity group, which consists of eight members. 

This is Thu’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is 41 years old and a resident of Iloilo, Philippines. He is married and has three children. The youngest child is 15. 

Regie has been engaged in fishing for 30 years now. Regie is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy nylon, rope, fishing nets and fishing weights. This will help Regie to increase his catch, and thus, increase his daily earnings and provide his family's daily needs. 

In the future, Regie would like to expand his fishing business to be able to pay his loan dues, improve his livelihood, and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy nylon, rope, fishing nets and fishing weights

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.en:
Edilberta is married and a 52-year-old mother of three children, who owns and operates an agriculture business growing rice for consumption and for sale. 

Edilberta has been engaged in farming for many years and she earns well from these activities. Her farm is still doing well, and yet she needs financial assistance to improve it.

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro to buy fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to buy a vehicle for her family's transportation to help improve their general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to restore farm nutrients

loans.name: Mariana Alejandrina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 64 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció  pero de esa relación tiene tres  hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun vive en su casa.
Doña Mariana es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ganarse lo suyo y con sus ingresos salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, zapatos y varios productos de bazar y bisutería, ella todos los días arma un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad lugar donde muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 18h00,  los días que mas ventas tienen son los fines de semana ya que en esos días son las ferias del cantón y salen muchas personas de los campos a abastecerse de víveres y allí ellos también comprar su mercadería. Tiene más de 30 años este negocio que le ha permitido salir sola adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como ropa, zapatos, bisutería entre otras cosas que vende. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace más de 18 años  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido salir adelante.  Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful landscapes and hot springs of sweet water, much visited by tourists, the “New Hope” Credit Group meets each 15 days.

In this place resides Mariana. She is 64 years old. Some years ago her husband died but the relationship produced three children, all of whom are adults now, though two still live in her house.

Mariana is a woman who likes to work to gain her living and with her income, to get ahead. She sells clothing of all types, including shoes and various clothing products and jewelry. Each day, she mans a small post in the center of the city, a location where many merchants offer their products. Mariana works every day from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. On weekends, she sells the most, since these are the days of the canton fair and many people from the countryside come in to obtain grocery supplies. While there, they also buy her merchandise. Mariana has been in this business for more than 30 years, and it has allowed her to advance and to offer the best for her children.

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, and jewelry, among other things she sells. Mariana has been a member of this credit group for more than 18 years and she likes it because with the loans, she was able to get ahead. Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, jewelry, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Lolit

texts.en:
Lolit is 45 years old and married with six children. She resides in Tukuran with her family. 

Lolit peddles fresh fish in the local community to make a living. For over fifteen years, it has sustained and provided for her children's education costs. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying fish to sell. She is now taking a new loan to buy fishing nets used for fishing. 

Lolit is hopeful to buy an additional unit of fishing boat and be able to operate her business safely.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets used for fishing.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Her name is Michelle, 35, and she is a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Perry, a contractual steward. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs. 

Michelle operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store, which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she is a dealer of popular brands of direct selling products for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan that she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expense. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Michelle hopes to maintain and grow her business. She also dreams of having a canteen to augment their income so she can save and build their dream house. She prays for a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries for her store.

loans.name: Margarita Del Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nueva Esperanza.
En este lugar vive la señora Margarita, tiene 38 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció  pero de esa relación tiene un hijo de 6 años el cual estudia en escuela, ella vive en casa de los padres.
Doña Margarita para salir adelante y  para que le falte nada a su hijo se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su mamá le ayudan en su tienda ya que ella también tiene un puesto en una de las calles principales de la ciudad lugar en el cual vende ropa de todo tipo, los días que más vende son los fines de semana. Tiene más de 15  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  hace más de 18 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The members of the Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) community bank meet every fortnight in the city of Santa Ana, well-known for its beautiful scenery and wonderful freshwater springs which are very popular with the tourists.The city is home to 38 year old Margarita, whose husband passed away some years ago, leaving her to care for their 6 year old son who is studying at school. She and her son live in her parents' home. Margarita has her own business, which has helped her to progress in life and provide whatever her son needs. She has a grocery shop in her home from where she sells all sorts of products, such as rice, oils, washing detergent, legumes, vegetable and fruit. She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later and she has been running this business for the last 15 years. Her busiest days in the shop are on the weekends.
She will use this loan to buy foodstuff and all sorts of clothing. She has been part of this community bank for the last 18 years and she likes it as the loans have helped her to progress in life. In the future she hopes to be successful in her business and provide the best that she can for her son.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and clothing

loans.name: Levita

texts.en:
From Laguna, Philippines, Levita is married and has children. She is employed in a garment factory in Cavite through the auspices of the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT). Levita works as a seamstress, sewing clothing according to the company or client’s dictates. She uses a sewing machine and other stitching machines as well as handstitching hems and linings.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Levita is meeting family expenses without access to savings or credit. Workers can become heavily indebted to money lenders who take their ATM cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason Levita is asking for your assistance to help her circumvent loan sharks. She has previously accessed loans through CCT and had no problem in repaying them since the loan payments were automatically deducted from her paycheck. She is seeking a 10,000 PHP loan to pay for her child’s tuition and to buy direct selling products like cosmetics, clothing, footwear and undergarments she needs to resell.

Levita hopes to give her children good educations. She looks forward to your positive response and says any amount will surely be of great help. 

CCT works to provide local communities with a trained labor force and equipped with the skills required for employment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative assists its members in acquiring those skills necessary for quality jobs, cultivating savings consciousness and providing decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs include Professional Staff Services, Workers Guild Development, Enterprise Development and Consultancy Services.

CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for factory workers such as Levita before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and after-work hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for her child’s tuition and to buy merchandise she needs in her direct selling business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 42 years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Teresa has been pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds to sell

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 32 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Judelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Judelyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Judelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Meliza's Group

texts.en:
Meliza is a 54-year-old proud mother of 6 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 9 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Meliza has noticed that she has been able to save more money.

Meliza described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Meliza’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation and a solar light.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en:
Muzaffar was born in 1992. He is a student of the fourth course. Muzaffar studies at the Technology University of Tajikistan. He is learning ecology. 

Muzaffar is one of the successful students. He is a very clever student. His hobby is playing football. 

Muzaffar’s dream is to be a good specialist in the future. He is asking for a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your mercy and thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Nhóm 05_Thôn Thiện Chính_Dân Lực Group

texts.en:
Mứt is 40 years old and she is married with two children. She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

 She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  She is the group leader of the Nhóm 05_Thôn Thiện Chính_Dân Lực solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Mứt faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

With her business profit, Mứt hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.en:
Abdugaffor was born in 1984. He lives with his family in a rural area. Abdugaffor is married and has four children. He works hard to provide his children with all necessary things. 

Abdugaffor has been busy with animal husbandry more than 15 years. He mainly feeds sheep. Abdugaffor buys sheep, feeds them for some months, and then sells them in a local market. Abdugaffor’s children help him with feeding the sheep. 

Abbugaffor is going to increase the number of sheep he feeds and, in this way, improve business. He awaits your mercy and, in advance, thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Melinde

texts.en:
Melinde earns a living by  engaging in buying and selling of fresh fish and delivering it to the nearby town using a motorcycle. She is a 43-year-old married woman and has three children ages 18,16 and 15. Together with her family, she lives in Dulag,Leyte. 

Aside from selling fish, she also engages in a food vending business. She cooks home-made vegetable meals, as an additional source of income. She has been engaged in this kind of business for ten years already.

Melinde has  requested a loan  of 20,000 PHP to purchase a variety of fresh fish and more supplies for food vending, like  squash and coconut. This will help improve the quantity of fish sold and will produce a huge volume of cooked vegetables as well. Therefore, it will create a higher impact on earnings, thus providing her children with good food.

Melinde hopes to expand both of her businesses to help support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fresh fish and more supplies for food vending like  squash and coconut

loans.name: Anarose

texts.en:
Anarose is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three children ages 10, 8, and 3 years old. She used to raise pigs as her source of income but was forced to stop after typhoon Haiyan ruined everything.

As of now, she has just started to rebuild again and wants to invest in a hog-raising business. She is requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. This loan will allow her to improve her livelihood and income.

Anarose hopes to expand her business in the future. She also wants to save money for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Rolan

texts.en:
Rolan is a 31-year-old man from Carles, Ilo-ilo. He is engaged in fishing in order to provide for his children and meet their basic needs. His kids are only two and four years of age. His wife works abroad in order to help him in saving for their children's future. It is a big sacrifice for both of them to be far from each other so that they can provide and save for their family. 

He is asking for a loan to buy plywood and fishing nets as well as to pay for boat repair. These investments will boost Rolan's confidence in his business. 

In the future, Rolan would like to expand his business in order to provide a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy plywood and fishing nets and to pay for boat repair.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is running a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells goods ranging from biscuits, sugar, eggs, powdered juice, milk, canned goods and soft drinks. She is 45 years old, married and has five children. Three of her children are still attending school. Aside from operating a store, Susana also raises and sells hogs. During her free time, she also engages in a food vending business. She sells home made meals.

Susana has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy assorted goods and supplies for her food vending business like coconut, vegetables, meat and  seasonings. This will help Susana continue to operate her livelihood, display more stocks for the store, and also offer variety of meals to her customers. This will create higher earnings, thus providing her family with good food and better living conditions.

Susana would like to expand her business, which would help improve the family's status of living,  as well as continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods and supplies for her food vending business like coconut, vegetables, meat and seasonings

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She lives in Concepcion, Iloilo and runs a small sari-sari (variety store) business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Jocelyn has been in the business for more than 10 years now.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods. With this purchase, she will be able to improve her inventory and attract more buyers into her store. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecila has been helping her husband in their transportation service to make a living. For over seven years, it has been their only way of earning an income for the family. It has been doing well and she has repaid successfully her previous loan used for the business. Aside from this, she is selling snacks at the school canteen to earn additional income. She took a new loan to buy additional snacks, candies and other food stuff to sell in her place in order to increase her sales. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to renovate their house for comfortable living for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional snacks, candies and other food stuff to sell in her place in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Roque Jr.

texts.en: Roque Jr. is 29 years old, single and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She offers pedicure and manicure services to make a living. In his free time, she started working in hairdressing and liked it a lot. She took a new loan recently to buy hair re-bonding products for her parlor. She wants to expand and improve her business in order to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy hair rebonding products for her parlor

loans.name: Zelda

texts.en: Zelda is 53 years old and lives in Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, the Philippines. She is single with no dependents.  Zelda has been engaged in the livestock business including poultry and pig raising for 4 years already. The earnings from her business support her brother and sister with their studies. She earns approximately PHP15,000 each month from doing this type of work; this amount is so helpful to meet her needs and the tuition fees of her siblings. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional construction materials to finish the construction of a piggery. Zelda has been a member of PMPC since this year. In the future, Zelda hopes to expand to goat raising and to have her own family.

loans.use: to buy  materials to finish construction of piggery

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita has been running a general store to make a living. The couple earns a good living from their efforts and investments, their retailing business and farming business. She had repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying grocery goods for her retail store.

To expand her business, she took a new loan to purchase rice, livestock feeds and more grocery goods in addition to her stock for sale. Her ability to be engaged in business is now improving and she was thankful to GDMPC for providing them investment capital to improve their living.

With their income derived from their farm and business, she was able to buy a motorcycle used for the transportation business and to carry their products from farm to market.

loans.use: to purchase rice, livestock feeds and more grocery goods in addition to her stock for sale

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has owned and operated a transport service for many years to earn a living. She has supported the family's daily needs with this income. 

Her previous loan used to repair her vehicle and to buy raincoats was repaid successfully. Recently, she took a new loan to buy motor and engine parts for the vehicle used for transportation services. She wants to renovate her house for a safer and more comfortable living for her family.

loans.use: to buy motor and engine parts for the vehicle used for transportation services.

loans.name: Stela

texts.en: Stela has been helping her husband in working on their own farm to make a living. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for organic fertilization of her farm. Her budget with her previous loan was not enough to cover the entire farm. So, she took a new loan recently to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm to become more productive. She is hopeful of gaining more income from her farm, for she has invested more capital in order to improve her farm.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm to become more productive

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is a factory worker. She is from Cavite, Philippines and has two children. She is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Maricar works as an Assistant Production Line Leader. She helps in inspection and test per control plan, work instruction and procedures. She maintains good housekeeping at all time at the respective working area. She is also responsible for the group of operators and carries out manpower utilization effectively to meet shipment.

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Maricar is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Maricar is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day. She looks forward for your positive response and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay their house rent.

Maricar dreams for success for her future plans in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to pay for their rent.

loans.name: Jemalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Jenalyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell  for her general store business.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 52 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, soap, coffee, milk, spices, etc.

Mila has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Mila aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, soap, coffee, milk, spices, etc.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice is 42 years old and has 6 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of 7 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Eunice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Although she described her last harvest as poor due to the effects of MLND (maize virus), Eunice believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Eunice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Eunice's Group will be able to receive a total of 5 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Neeti Shanti

texts.en:
Agriculture has been a prime source to earn a livelihood in India for close to 60% of the population. Most of the time, the marginalized people have land to grow crops, but due to financial constraints, are not able to buy fertilizers, seeds, or irrigation facilities.

Neeti Shanti, 45, hails from Orvakal village of Kurnool district of Andhra Pradesh, India. She is a widow, and her family comprises a son and a daughter. Her husband was an alcoholic and never went to work. All the responsibilities of running the family were on Neeti Shanti. She is very hardworking.

Her current income is not sufficient, and with the daunting responsibilities that she will face in the future, as in financing her children’s future, it is imperative that she uses the land for paddy and jowar (sorghum) cultivation.

She is a member of Sahaja Samrudha NGO. The NGO helps in training, mutual sharing of ideas, motivation and help. Neeti Shanti needs a loan for the paddy and jowar cultivation, for which she will need to buy fertilizers, seeds, etc. With financing in place, she can expect to bring stability to her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Merab's Group

texts.en:
Merab's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Butere District and is represented by Merab, the group leader pictured above. She is 45 years old, is married and has 4 children. Merab has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Merab isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Merab will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Merab's Group will purchase a total of 8 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve maize harvests

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a 47-year-old proud father of 7 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 9 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Patrick has noticed that he has been able to save more money.

Patrick described his harvest as good last year, but he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Patrick’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients in bulk to sell oven-roasted food and baked dough.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia is a widow with two children who lives in Misom, Baliangao, Philippines. 

At age of 64, Felecia manages her sari-sari store very well and helps her family survive their daily needs. Felecia has been doing this type of business for more than 20 years. 

Felecia expanded her sari-sari store with the assistance of Paglaum Cooperative through the loan services that she availed. She applied the amount of 14,000 PHP to buy two sacks of white and brown sugar and other stocks with high demand from customers. The rest of the money will buy two piglets as another source of business because she dreams and hopes to engage in meat dealing with help of her two responsible children in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is aged 28, single and a mother of three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost one year and earns a net income of PHP 600 daily. Her net income is spent on the school allowances of her children.

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase coffee, detergent soap, food seasonings, canned goods, noodles, sugar, beverages, and creamer.

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, detergent soap, food seasonings, canned goods, noodles, sugar, beverages, and creamer.

loans.name: Phương

texts.en:
Phương operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Phương is 49 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is  Phương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that  Phương faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick,  and other equipment for a toilet to build toilet .

With her business profit,  Phương hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and toilet equipment to build toilet.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria owns and operates an ornamental plant business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for nine years, and she was able to repay her previous loan. She also finds ways to boost her income and provide for the needs of her family.

Maria would like to take out a new loan to buy additional gardening materials and supplies. She is requesting an amount of 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and various hanging plants.

Maria wants to give her children a good quality education. She also dreams of having a bigger and better space for her ornamental plants. She meets up with her fellowship group* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and garden inputs she needs for her business to keep going even this rainy season.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and a general store business. Ronelyn is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Ronelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and more paints for her son's painting work

loans.name: Abdulghamid

texts.en:
Abdulghamid is a 39-year-old married man and a father of 4 children, living with his family in a very old and small house. Due to the high rates of ignorance in this area, Abdulghamid couldn't go to school, and is an uneducated man. His income is very limited and not enough to cover the family's necessary needs and to make necessary renovations to their house. 

Abdulghamid applied for a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase iron steel, bricks, cement and other construction materials to renovate his house and to make a hall for it. Abdulghamid hopes to build another new house.

loans.use: to purchase iron steel, bricks, cement and other construction materials to renovate his house and to make a hall for the house.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. Christine is representing her group of 9 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Christine has been a farmer for 20 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light. With the profits from this coming season, Christine is planning to save more money for the future.

A total of 4.75 acres will be planted by Christine's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation, and a solar light.

loans.name: Sawe Mutiara Indah Group

texts.en:
After a six-month loan period, Ayu Ketut successfully sold her piglets with a satisfactory profit, because the price of fattening pigs is very high in the last three months. Just as Ayu Ketut, most of the members of the Sawe Mutiara Indah group earned a satisfactory result, and they decided to continue their loan until they can have their own capital. Now, after they succeeding in pig program, for the new loan, the group decided to use it to support their other businesses, such as a kiosk, making religious articles, and selling crops. Two of the members resigned from the group after they had enough profit to continue the effort by themselves.
The group now receives its loan with only eight members. Ayu Ketut uses her portion of loan (1.500.000 IDR) from total loan of 12.000.000 IDR for the group, to purchase merchandise for her kiosk. She plans to increase the amount of merchandise in her kiosk, to include items for daily needs and school needs.
Ayu Ketut and the members of the Sawe Mutiara Indah feel the benefits of having this loan. They can manage their businesses and manage the profit. They hope they can have capital of their own, so they won’t need to borrow a loan again.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her kiosk.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a retail business, selling clothes. 
She is 25 years old, is married, and has two children. 
She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.
This is Hương first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hương has been involved in her retail business for five years.

The main hardship that Hương faces in her life is the lack of a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipments to build biogas system.
With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase equipments to build biogas system

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Dinh operates a food stall selling vegetables. Dinh is 63 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Dinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dinh has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Dinh faces in her life is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipments to build biogas system.

With her business profit, Dinh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase equipments to build biogas system.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Mrs. Trang works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Trang has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Trang is 33 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Trang's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Trang faces in her life is not having a biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipments to build biogas system.

With her business profit, Trang hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipments to build biogas system.

loans.name: Tân

texts.en:
Mr. Tân operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. Tân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Tân is 46 years old, and he is married with three children. He lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tân faces in his life is not having a biogas system. He is requesting a loan to purchase equipments to build biogas system.

Tân hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase equipments to build biogas system.

loans.name: Bình

texts.en:
Bình is 31 years old and married with no children. Bình lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Bình has successfully repaid one loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bình has been involved in her business for five years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her business to do well, and for her children to be healthy and happy and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Quyên

texts.en:
Quyên is 39 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Quyên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. 

The main hardship that Quyên faces in her life is not having a  hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

Mrs. Quyên operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Quyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. With her business profit, Quyên hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Đức

texts.en:
Mrs. Đức operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. Đức has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Đức is 50 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Đức's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Đức faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks,... to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Đức hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Đông

texts.en:
Đông is 45 years old and he is married with two children. He lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Đông works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
In 2013, Đông joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his  business. He has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
The main hardship that Đông faces in his life is not having a latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.
In the future, Đông hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Sơn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sơn operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. Sơn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Sơn is 42 years old, and she is married with four children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province

The main hardship that Sơn faces in her life is not having a  biogas system. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipments to build biogas system.

This is Sơn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Sơn hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase equipments to build biogas system.

loans.name: Leonaora

texts.en:
Leonaora, 64 years old, is married with five adult-age children; she lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidentaal, Philippines. 

She ventures in sari-sari store business, but because she needs to have an extra income, she will invest in a hog raising business. 

With this, she borrows money from PMPC to buy two pigs to support her family. 

With the help aided by the institution, she is very happy.

loans.use: To purchase two pigs to have an extra business to support family needs

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina, 60 years old, is a dressmaker from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is happily married and has four children. Marina has been in the tailoring business for 34 years, generating income for her family. She needs to purchase construction materials for house repairs. She is taking out a loan of PHP 50,000, which will be a big help for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repairs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs for her pig-fattening business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 10 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 23 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. Ivy has been running a general store in the Philippines for the past four years and she also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Ivy has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has now requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc. to sell.

Ivy aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
