loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc. to sell

loans.name: Zoila Marina

texts.es:
Zoila, con la ayuda de créditos anteriores está teniendo un progreso constante con su negocio de venta de pupusas, su situación económica ha mejorado y puede brindar mejor alimentación diaria su familia, la cartera de clientes es más grande por lo que ha tomado a bien ofrecer frutas picada para ir diversificando su negocio.
Está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir en harina, quesillo, aceite, repollo, manzanas, papayas, etc., así elaborara la venta de pupusas y ofrecerá frutas frescas a sus clientes, espera tener un margen de ganancias mayor.
texts.en: Zoila, with the help of previous loans, is making constant progress with her business in selling stuffed tortillas. Her economic situation has improved and she can better provide for her family. Her list of clients is bigger so she has taken to offering chopped fruits to diversify her business. She's asking for a new loan to invest in flour, tortillas, oil, cabbage, apples, papayas, etc, so she will be able to prepare and sell stuffed tortillas and offer fresh fruits to her clients. She hopes to have a better profit margin.

loans.use: to invest in flour, tortillas, oil, cabbage, apples, papayas, etc, so she can prepare and sell stuffed tortillas and offer fresh fruits to her clients.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 57 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Lina has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Lina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Romana, 41 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kesses, a remote village in Eldoret. She is happily married and is blessed with six adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last fifteen years and has gained so much experience.

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business.

The Eldoret area is very populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Fridah's Group

texts.en:
Fridah is a 66-year-old proud mother of 8 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 9 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Fridah has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Fridah described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Fridah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 3 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Yoeun's Group

texts.en: Yoeun’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. Yoeun makes a living cultivating rice and she also works as teacher. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members safeguard their families' health, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en: Kim’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. Kim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farm laborer. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en: Phen’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. Phen makes a living cultivating rice. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yort's Group

texts.en: Yort’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. Yort makes a living cultivating rice. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Nueva Esperanza, lleva este nombre, ya que todas tienen la esperanzas puestas en poder ayudar a sus familias y poder crecer, es un grupo nuevo que se unió con muchas esperanzas.
A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo la Sra. Míguela quien se dedica a la venta de prendas varias, va mejorando, ella comenta que aunque tiene mucha competencia ella se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas, esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) as all of the members hope to help their families and to grow. It is a new group that came together with high hopes.

Through consistent work and effort, Míguela, who sells various articles of clothing, is bettering herself. She says that, although there is a lot of competition, she works hard to help her family and loved ones. She is requesting this loan to buy various clothing items so that she can continue to make sales and strive to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy various articles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh is 63 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. 
Minh works in agriculture farming rice. Minh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2010, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa FPW. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having  a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. 
In the future, Minh hopes to remodel her house, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet

loans.name: Tảo

texts.en:
Mrs. Tảo is 41 years old, and she is married with four children. 
She lives  in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Tảo operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. This is Tảo's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
The main hardship that Tảo faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.
In the future, Tảo hopes for her children to do well in school, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Hùng

texts.en:
Hùng works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Hùng is 51 years old and married with two children. He lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hùng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Hùng faces in his life is not having a hygenic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet. With his business profits, Hùng hopes to maintain a successful business, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business, and for his business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet

loans.name: Tripona

texts.en: Tripona  is managing her eatery business in Liloy. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. They have been doing well supporting the needs of the family. Tripona has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. Recently, she loaned an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Virgillo

texts.es:
Virgillo tiene 51 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su cónyuge y tres hijos; uno de 23 años que aporta ingresos la UEF con estudios primarios, la segunda una hija de 14 años también con estudios primarios y una hija de 7 años de edad que estudia en escuela del caserío Andamarca donde radican, vive en casa propia de material rustico de dos piso, Virgillo es nacido en caserío Andamarca sector el Huabo; vive en armonía familiar y en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, vive en la parte rural del caserío Andamarca Distrito de Santo Tomas; en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua.

La actividad que realiza Virgillo es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 has. Variedad Catimor, plantación tiene 3 años de edad ya que en la zona todos tienen plantaciones nuevas; esta en segundo año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio 3 has. donde realiza cultivo de café, actividad la realiza hace 10 años ya que anteriormente a cultiva café variedad nacional. Cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café.

Adicionalmente cliente se dedica a la actividad pecuaria cría de ganado vacuno contando a la fecha con 5 reses y también al cultivo y productos de pan llevar todo esto lo realiza en terreno propio en caserío Andamarca. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 1 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurara mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Virgillo is 51 years old and has a stable household with his spouse and their three children; one is 23 years old and brings earnings into the household with a primary education; the second is a 14-year-old girl who also completed primary education; and a 7-year-old girl who goes to school in Andamarca hamlet, where they live. 

The family lives in their own, two-story house made with rustic materials. Virgilio was born in Andamarca hamlet, in the Huabo sector. He lives in harmony with his family and the other inhabitants in the hamlet. He lives in the rural part of Andamarca hamlet, Santo Tomas district, in a small community where most of the inhabitants farm or raise livestock. His house has access to water. 

Virgilio cultivates coffee, with one hectare of cultivation at this time. He grows the Catimor variety, and the plantation is 3 years old. In this area, all the plantations are new. This is his second year of production. He owns an agricultural plot of 3 hectares, on which he cultivates coffee. He has been doing this work for 10 years, while before he cultivated the national Cuenta variety. He has experience in the work of cultivating coffee. 

This client also raises livestock, in particular cattle, with five cows at the moment, and cultivates and produces bread. All this is done on his land in Andamarca hamlet. 

This loan will be used to maintain one hectare of coffee beans already in production. With this he can ensure a larger and better crop for the 2015 harvest, and in the end obtain better income so he can in turn improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to maintain one hectare of coffee beans already in production.

loans.name: Mechill

texts.en:
Mechill is 39 years old,maried and has five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Mechill requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mechill has been pig fattening for eleven years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mechill would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar, 36 years old, lives with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh seasonal vegetables and fruits at a shop in a nearby town for many years. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this vegetable and fruit shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and Kishwar's husband does not have other sources to cope with these needs. He therefore decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetable and fruits. Kishwar has requested a loan so that her husband can buy more vegetables and fruits for selling. Kishwar is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables and fruits for her husband's business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fruits to sell for her buy and sell fruits business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fruits to sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josefa is 54 years old now.

Josefa has a buy and sell eggs business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Josefa has been in this business for three years and would like to rebuild it with your help.

Josefa requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy additional eggs for the business to restart her business activities.
 
In the future, Josefa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional eggs for the business.

loans.name: Enrique Octavio

texts.es:
Enrique es un hombre de 54 años, separado; vive con un sobrino que lo crió desde muy pequeño ya que sus padres fallecieron, juntos viven en una pequeña y humilde vivienda ubicada en la vía a San Cristóbal, un pueblito muy acogedor con atractivos turísticos, de clima cálido y agradable. Enrique trabaja como jornalero en una finca, pero también arrienda dos hectáreas de terreno donde hace tres años se dedica a la producción de maracuyá y maíz.
Enrique es un señor muy trabajador y humilde, acudió a Fundación Alternativa por un vecino que es cliente de la institución. Enrique con este crédito podrá mantener la finca y además podrá comprar semillas de maíz para sembrar ya que es temporada de siembra. Agradecen a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Enrique is 54 years old, he is separated and lives with a nephew that he raised from a very young age as his parents died. Together they live in a small and modest house situated on the San Cristóbal road just outside the is the cute small town with tourist attractions and a pleasing climate. 

He works as a day labourer on a farm, but he has also rented two hectares of land for the past three years, producing passion fruit and corn.

Enrique is a very hardworking and humble man, he turned to Fundación Alternativa through a neighbour who is also a client of the institution. With this loan Enrique will be able to maintain his land and in addition buy corn seeds as it is the season for sowing. He is grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible growth in both his working and personal life.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds for harvest

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice's Group is formed by nine farmers in Butere District. The group is being represented here by Beatrice, who is the group leader, pictured above. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three children. Beatrice has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very friendly person.

Beatrice isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2012. Since then she has noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to feed her family, consistently. This year, Beatrice will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and thereby save more money.

Using this loan, Beatrice's Group will purchase a total of four solar lights, and will purchase enough farming inputs to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve her harvest of maize.

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet is a 38-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing her group of 11 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Violet has noticed that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Violet described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Violet’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en: Phal’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. Phal makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ouk's Group

texts.en: Ouk’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Ouk makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Katerine

texts.es: Katherine, inspirada en su deseo de ser una trabajadora independiente y tener su propio negocio, decidió vender productos para el aseo personal y del hogar y también comercializa productos naturales ofreciéndolos a crédito o pago de contado en cada una de las casas, lo que significa venta puerta a puerta. Su negoció inicio en el año 2011 y sus clientes iniciales fueron amigos y referidos, su éxito ha sido su buen servicio y productos de excelente calidad razones que han logrado mantener sus clientes fidelizados.  Esta habitante del barrio los Robles, del municipio de Soledad tiene 31 años de edad y vive con su cónyuge, tienen dos hijos un niño de 1 año y una niña de 7 años. Su intensión de inversión está enfocada hacia la captación de nuevos mercados por lo que decidió hacer su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para lograr aumentar su cobertura y con ello aumentar su flujo de caja encaminado a mejorar su calidad de vida.  Con este financiamiento comprará detergentes, suavizantes, jabones de baño, productos alimenticios naturales, con lo cual mejorará su negocio aumentando la cobertura de clientes con un mayor inventario; su meta en el negocio es crecer comercialmente y con este crédito empezará su escala ascendente.
texts.en:
Katherine, inspired in her desire to be an independent worker and have her own business, decided to sell personal hygiene and household products. She also sells natural products and offers them on loan or in cash in each house, what we call door-to-door sales.

Her business opened in 2011 and her initial customers were friends and people referred to her. Her success has been her good service and the products of excellent quality, with which she has managed to maintain loyal customers. This resident of the Robles neighborhood, in the municipality of Soledad, is 31 years old and lives with her spouse. They have two children, a 1-year-old boy and a 7 year old girl. Her intention for investment is focused on capturing new markets on the way to improving her quality of life. With this loan, she will purchase detergents, softeners, bath soaps, and natural food products, with which she will improve her business expanding her customer range with a better inventory. Her business goal is to expand commercially and with this loan she will begin her upward climb.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, softeners, bath soaps, and natural food products.

loans.name: Nicolas De Jesus

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de un joven microempresario de tan solo 21 años de edad llamado Nicolás el cual heredo de su familia un negocio de producción agrícola, más específicamente producción de leche y que sueña con más con ser una mejor empresa que produce a gran escala y no tiene miedo de soñar e invertir en su negocio por tal razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de 2 vacas, lo que justifica el monto y es que el precio de una vaca preñada es alto. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá generar más leche y pensar en tener un marca distinguida como proveedora y tener trabajo fijo para todo el año que es su gran sueño pues de su finca se beneficia la mayoría de su familia y a pesar de su edad quiere apoyarlos y acogerlos a todos.
texts.en:
This is the story of a young micro-entrepreneur that is only 21 years old, named Nicolas. He inherited an agricultural production business from his family, more specifically the production of milk. He dreams of more, and of being a better business that produces at a large scale. He is not afraid to dream and invest in his business, for this reason he is requesting a loan to buy 2 cows. What justifies the amount is the fact that the price of a pregnant cow is high.

With the help of the loan, he will be able to produce more milk, and he is thinking about having a distinguished brand as a provider and having fixed work for the entire year. This is his big dream since the majority of his family benefits from his farm, and despite his age he wants to support them and take them all in.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Akbar is a 28-year old man who, throughout his life, has managed to strengthen and work hard for his business. He is married and has a 6-month-old daughter. The family is living in Orvakal village, Kurnool, Andhra Pradesh. His spouse is a housewife, and Akbar cultivates bananas and cotton in his own land of 1 acre. He also works as a daily wage worker in agriculture fields. The area in which he is located is covered with agriculture land, ponds, and the river, so the agriculture is very much suitable in this area. 

Akbar is requesting financing in order to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. This will give him a better quality crop as well as an excellent result at the end of the season. He hopes to save enough for his daughter’s education. He wants to strengthen the value of his land so that his family will inherit the land along with their professional jobs and will keep cultivating for generations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Chanly's Group

texts.en: The members of Chanly’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province, in Cambodia. Chanly makes a living cultivating rice, to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save the time they would have spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Phoeurng's Group

texts.en: The members of Phoeurng’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province, in Cambodia. Phoeurng makes a living cultivating rice, to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save the time they would have spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Simon Segundo

texts.es:
Simón es un campesino de 31 años de edad que heredo un campo de cultivos por parte de su padre el cual trabaja diariamente para producir y mantener a su familia y allegados.
Por cuestiones climáticas y temporadas difíciles Simón quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos como semillas, abonos y canales de riegos para levantar su empresa que pro la falta de capital se ha estado decayendo y hoy que le dan la oportunidad una entidad como interactuar quiere aprovecharla pues su deseo es ver convertida su finca en una gran productora de cultivos.
texts.en: Simón is a 31 year old farmer. He inherited farmland from his father. He works it daily to produce product and support his family. With changing weather and difficult seasons, Simon wants to seek a loan to buy supplies such as seeds, manure, and irrigation channels to support his business that without capital to invest is decaying and today he has an opportunity through Interactuar that he would like to take advantage of. His dream is to convert his farm into a great producer of crops.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops such as manure, irrigation channels, and seeds.

loans.name: Grupo Job Noj Group

texts.es:
De 42 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene cuatro hijos los primeros dos hijos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad. (Dominga es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda de la fotografía)	

El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de trajes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 10 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de verduras negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Dominga para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de trajes típicos para luego venderlas por los alrededores de su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Dominga, 42, is married and lives with her husband.  She wants to improve herself in life and achieve her big dreams.  She has four children; the first two already have their own families and the younger two are excellent students in the school in their community.  (She's the first one on the right in the photograph.)

She has great aspirations for making her work (which she does with so much effort and dedication) known to the community and to all who visit.  The work she does so painstakingly is buying and selling traditional outfits.  She works at home and in nearby places in her community.  She has done this work for 10 years.  Her second job is selling vegetables, a business she and her sister have had for more than five years because it generates a profit for her family's well-being and to improve the financial situations of her family and the community.

Dominga has been an example in her community.  That's why a group of women joined her, so they can start their businesses to improve themselves and earn a substantial income.

She's going to use the loan to buy merchandise--traditional outfits--to sell around her community.

One of Dominga's goals is to have a retail space in the market in her community and see her children become professionals in life.

loans.use: to buy traditional outfits

loans.name: Kareema's Group

texts.en:
Kareema is a 38-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. Kareema's husband provides whitewash and oil paint services to his customers in the community and sometimes out of city. He has gotten a new contract to whitewash and paint a newly constructed house but he has no paint brushes or rollers to provide his services.

Kareema requested a loan so that her husband could buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene oil, etc. Her husband’s savings are very poor, so he is unable to buy new tools to provide his whitewash services. Kareema wants to change her family's condition and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband.
Kareema is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy materials for her husband's painting work

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn  is 33 years old, married, and lives with her family. She has a retail store serving several customers. She sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income, while her husband works as a company driver.

Analyn has been in this field for four years. She is working hard every day in order to provide income for the family and to show customers that she is responsible and reliable.
 
Analyn requested this loan to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and grains to sell in her store. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, and grains to sell in her store.

loans.name: Olga Cecilia

texts.es:
Olga es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con sus hijos. Inició desesperadamente la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. 

Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que en un principio le estaba generando ganancias con las cuales podía sostener los gastos de su hogar. Posteriormente, el negocio entró en dificultades y este ya no le proporcionaba todos los ingresos que eran necesarios, por lo que empezó paralelamente a fabricar arepas, y con estos dos negocios logró generar los ingresos que necesitaba en su hogar. 

Con el ánimo de sacar estos negocios adelante, Olga busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de pollos de engorde, alimento para los mismos y construccion de galpon.

Olga tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita suplir sus necesidades en el corto plazo y esto le ayude a salir adelante con su negocio. 

Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Olga is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her children. She began doing so by looking for a source of income for her home. This is how she began raising and selling chickens, a business that has generated profits to cover her household's expenses at the beginning. Since then, it has had problems and it is not providing the necessary income, which is why she also began making arepas. With these two businesses, she has been able to generate the income her household needs. 
With the goal of furthering these businesses, Olga is looking for a loan that will give her the opportunity to invest in more chickens and feed; as well as construction for a new shed for them to live. 

Olga hopes that the loan will cover her short term needs and get ahead with the business. Moreover, she hopes that the business will grow and generate a larger income with which she will be able to offer her children a better quality-of-life and more opportunities to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy chickens and food to fatten them, as well as supplies to construct a chicken coop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more poultry birds.

loans.name: Sereyroth's Group

texts.en: The members of Sereyroth’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province, in Cambodia. Sereyroth makes a living cultivating rice, to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save the time they would have spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Doris Amalia

texts.es:
Doris es una mujer muy emprendedora y tenaz, con grandes deseos que ha estado cultivando y tratando de cumplir.

Tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas rápidas en el municipio de La Dorada.

Con esta actividad intenta día a día  salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia compuesta por su esposo y su hijo quien es el motor de su vida y su motivación para luchar diariamente.

Su mayor dificultad es la competencia del sector, pero con su gran capacidad de trabajo es capaz de sostenerse y progresar.

Doris solicita un préstamo para realizar la compra de ingredientes para sus preparaciones como carne, maíz, queso, entre otros.

Con esta ayuda podrá cumplir su sueño de otorgar una buena educación a su hijo

Con tu ayuda Doris Podrá mejorar su negocio!
texts.en:
Doris is a very enterprising and persevering woman with big dreams, which she has been nurturing and trying to fulfill. 

She has a small business selling fast food at the municipality of La Dorada. With this business, she tries to get ahead day by day and improve the living conditions of her family, who consist of her husband and their son. Her son is the driving force in her life and who motivates her to work hard every day. Her biggest challenge is the competition in the area. However, with her work abilities, she is capable of sustaining her business and making it thrive.

Doris is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, corn, and cheese, among other items, to prepare the food.

With this assistance, she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing her son with a good education.

With your help, Doris will better her business and hopefully with these profits pay for her son to have better education!

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, corn, and cheese, among other items, for her food creations.

loans.name: Shankramma

texts.en:
Shankramma is in her 60s. She cultivates red gram, foxtail millet, and jowar (sorghum) on her land. She also is a daily wage worker in agriculture fields. The income that she is generating from the yield is not enough to support her family. She lives with her husband and son. Her son is handicapped and he is preparing for exams to get a job. 

Shankramma is a member of Shaja Samrudha, a local NGO, and has benefited from this involvement through training and employment opportunities provided to the SHG. She hails from Orvakal village in the Kurnool district of Andhra Pradesh, which is characterized by a lot of agricultural land but poor financial support to help people alleviate poverty. Shankramma is very energetic, enthusiastic, and determined to shape her future through sheer hard work and cooperation. Now she motivates and encourages other women on activities to support their families and their children’s education.

Shankramma will be using the Kiva loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to cultivate red gram, foxtail millet, and jowar. Her work will help her to have better prices both at the time of buying and selling. She is very thankful to the generous investors who stand for her cause.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily is a 45-year-old, proud mother of eight children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hard-working individual and she is representing her group of nine farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Emily has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Emily described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is also very excited to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Emily’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and purchase a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Philis's Group

texts.en:
Philis, who is often described as a very hard-working individual, is a proud 34-year-old mother of five children. She is a group leader, representing her group of four farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Philis has noticed that she has had more profits from each harvest.

Philis described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to be purchasing, in addition to hybrid maize seeds and fertilizer, a solar light because she will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Philis’s Group will be able to plant a total of 2.75 acres of land and purchase four solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Francis's Group

texts.en:
Francis, pictured above, is 54 years old, is married and has 10 children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 12 farmers in Webuye District. 

Francis likes to think of himself as a very hard-working individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Francis plans to use the profits from this coming season to invest in a business.

In total, Francis’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 6.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 38 years old and has seven children. She is a group leader, and is here representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Rosemary has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although she described her last harvest as poor (due to bad weather conditions), she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Rosemary also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan this year. She is very excited about this purchase, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and, thereby, save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Rosemary's Group will receive a total of eight solar lights, and farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights, and cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Emily's Group

texts.en:
Emily is a 38-year-old, proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, and often described as a very hardworking individual. She is here representing her group of eight farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Emily has noticed that she has been able to feed her family consistently.

Emily says her harvest was excellent last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to be purchasing a solar light this year, in addition to fertilizer and maize seeds, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to study by. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to buy more land to cultivate.

Using this loan, Emily’s Group will plant a total of 3.75 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa Angelica tiene 37 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, reside en el caserío el PPJJ 9 de Octubre, desde hace más de 15 años junto a sus padres. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila ya que se dedican al comercio y crianza de ganado menor. Dicho caserío está ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Rosa Angelica es a la venta de abarrotes, chifles desde hace más de 5 años. El destino del crédito será para capital de trabajo, compra de mercaderia: gaseosas, chifles, arroz, azúcar, panteones,galletas, golosinas ya que se acercan las fiestas navideñas. Rosa Angelica cuenta con muy buenas referencias en la zona en donde vive y sus antecedentes crediticios son buenos también. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido al aumento de población y entrada de empresas privadas que dan trabajo a mas personas.
texts.en:
Rosa Angelica is 37 years old and single. She has lived in the community of PPJJ 9 de Octubre with her parents for more than 15 years. Life in the community is quiet and the people work in commerce and raising small animals. The village is in the district and province of Morropón, Piura region on the North Coast of Peru.

Rosa Angelica has been working selling groceries and snack foods for more than 5 years. The loan will be used for working capital buying merchandise: soft drinks, snack food, rice, sugar, Christmas cakes, biscuits and sweets as the Christmas festivities are approaching. Rosa Angelica has good references in the area she lives in and also has a good loan record. The market is offering a good outlook given the increase in the population and the arrival of private companies which provide work for more people.

loans.use: to have working capital to buy merchandise: soft drinks, snack food, rice, sugar, Christmas cakes, biscuits and sweets as the Christmas festivities are approaching.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Antonio está en el ciclo número 3 del programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza que le permitirá poder trabajar en los puntos que tenga débiles.
Ignacia se destaca en este grupo, por ser una mujer entusiasta y que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante, ella es la presidenta de este grupo, y comenta que siempre trata de ayudar a sus compañeras, y también por su parte se dedica a la venta de cosméticos varios para poder dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos variados para poder continuar con sus ventas y seguir luchando por crecer en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The San Antonio group is in its third loan cycle of the program Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras [Committee of Women Entrepreneurs]. They are also completing the poverty elimination survey which will help them to work on their weak spots.

Ignacia stands out in this group because she is an enthusiastic women who strives to get ahead. She is the president of the group and she mentions that she always tries to help her partners. She also makes a living selling various cosmetics so that she can give her family a life with dignity and without deprivations. 

She is requesting this loan so she can buy various cosmetics to be able to continue her sales and keep fighting to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Esmerito Reymundo

texts.es:
El señor emerito es habitante del departamento de chinandega es casado padre de dos hijos en edades escolares el solicita el financiamiento para la compra de materiales como zinc, madera , clavos y pago de mano de obra para poner el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y en este invierno se a pasado el agua.


es un hombre trabajador, responsable  que trabaja 24 horas como vigilante cuatro veces a la semana el señor lucha por sacar adelante a su familia y que sus hijos se preparen
texts.en:
Emerito is a resident os the department of Chinandega. He is married and the father of two children who are school aged. He is asking for the loan to buy materials such as zinc, wood, and nails as well as to pay for labor to put a roof on his house which is in poor condition because this rainy season water has come in.  

He is a hard working man who is responsible. He works 24 hours a day as a guard 4 times a week. He fights to get his family ahead and to educate his childlren.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Ana Clorinda

texts.es: Doña Ana de 67 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, su hijo y su nieto, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 20 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Ana esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima como hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo ya que le ha ido muy bien con las ganancias y asi podrá seguir teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is 67 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband, son, and grandson. For the past 20 years, she has made a living making clothes. Her sewing workshop is located in her home, and she has many customers as a result of the quality of the clothes that she makes.

Maria is once again requesting a loan to buy more raw materials such as threads, needles, an assortment of fabrics, buttons, elastics, etc. in order to continue her work, since she has done very well with the earnings. This way, she will continue to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials such as threads, needles, an assortment of fabrics, buttons, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Karina Iveth

texts.es: Karina de 28 años de edad habita junto a su hija de 13 años de edad y su hermana ya mayor de edad en vivienda propia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida desde hace mucho tiempo con su negocio de un molino de nixtamal, el cual se encuentra en su domicilio. Karina toda su vida se ha dedicado a operar su molino de nixtamal es por eso que ella desea ampliarlo para poder atender a una mayor cantidad de personas y así poder obtener mejores ganancias, es para ello que Karina solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: herramientas y más maquinas para el molino de nixtamal.
texts.en:
Karina is 28 years old and has lived in her own house with her 13-year-old daughter and her older sister for 28 years. She is a hard-working woman who for a long time has earned a living with her corn mill business, which is situated in her home.

Karina has spent all her life working the corn mill and so she wants to expand it so she can serve a larger number of customers and so make more profits. This is why Karina is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy tools and more machinery for the corn mill.

loans.use: to buy tools and more machinery for the corn mill.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria Lourdes mayor de edad casada con cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina, el ron, la caña y azúcar, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación persona, es una microempresaria administradora y propietaria de sus propios negocios como venta de mercadería en general : variedades estilo de ropas para adultos y niños por encargos tambien entre dos o tres veces por semana,  tiene un negocio de venta de granos básicos como: pan, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, fósforos y mejoras como: carnes de res, cerdos, pollo embutidos entre otros los cuales entrega tambien por encargos en una hacienda cafetalera y principalmente la venta de tortillas en los tres tiempos, todas sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados y distribuidoras de esta misma localidad, inicia este negocio desde muy joven el cual lo aprende de su mama quien era la que se dedicaba a este negocio y el cual lo hereda, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a trabajadores de la hacienda los cuales recupera cada quincena, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas como: maiz, cal, leña, bolsas plasticas y tambien alguno granos básicos como: arroz,azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, café, entre otros mas, para lograr cubrir varios pedidos que tiene de productos de consumo del hogar, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos, Maria Lourdes agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is older, married with four adult children. She is a native of the municipality of Chinandega located in the west of the country. Rum, sugar cane and sugar are the predominant products of the zone. She is hard-working responsible with much desire to excel.

She is a micro-entrepreneur and administrator and owner of her own businesses like the sale of general merchandise: clothing of a variety of styles for adults and children by order two or three times per week. She has a business selling basic grains like bread, rice, sugar, beans, oil, matches and special requests like beef, pork, chickens, sausages amongst others. She distributes them on order at a coffee plantation. She also sells tortillas for the three meals.

She makes all her purchases in cash in the area's markets and distributors. She started this business when she was very young. She learned fro her mother who worked in this business and she inherited it from her. She has steady and casual clients. Her sales are in cash and on credit to the farm workers which she collects every fortnight.

The objective of this new loan is to invest in the purchase of materials to make and sell tortillas, such as corn, lime, wood and plastic bags, as well as basic grains, like rice, sugar, beans, oil, soap, coffee, corn, bread, wood amongst others to cover customer's household demands. One of her dreams is to be able to improve her economic income. Maria Lourdes is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders provide for people of low economic resources. She will invest in working capital as well as improving the area where the oven is.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tortillas and purchase other grocery products to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 23 years old and has two children in school. Marites is a married woman, and she works hard for her family.

Marites is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Marites has been in business for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hanelyn

texts.en:
Hanelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business, buying and selling fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional fish to sell. Hanelyn has been in this business for six years, now.

In the future, Hanelyn would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 32, is married and has three children. Two of her children and in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use it to purchase boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 56 years old and is married with seven children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Leonor runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, biscuits, soap, noodles, candies, junk food, and other grocery items. 

Leonor has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 37 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. Gemma has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marieta works hard to support her family. She has a prepared-food business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Marieta is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients, like flour, for her prepared-food business. Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like flour, for her business.

loans.name: Harrison's Group

texts.en:
Harrison is a 60-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He is married and his spouse is also a farmer. He has 11 children, all of whom are in school. In addition to growing trees, Harrison supports his family through farming. 

He decided to join Komaza because he had unused land on which he wished to capitalize. Harrison plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to invest in constructing rental houses to provide a steady income stream for educating his children. Harrison’s favourite part about working with Komaza is harvesting cowpeas as part of the short-term crops program.

Harrison is the farmer with his hand raised in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Habil's Group

texts.en:
Habil is 58 years old and is often described as a very reliable person. He  is married and has two children. As a group leader, Habil is representing his group of seven farmers in Butere District in Kenya. He is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Habil's desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Apart from receiving farming inputs, such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer, he is also purchasing a solar light as part of his loan. This is very exciting to Habil as he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits that he gains from this year’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

Habil and his group will receive five solar lights as well as input loans to purchase maize seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 3.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Teresinah's Group

texts.en:
Teresinah is 38 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Teresinah is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Teresinah started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010. She decided to do so, because she wanted to receive quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. This year she decided to represent her group, because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Teresinah’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land, on credit. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer, for the coming planting season.

loans.name: Lorena Patricia

texts.en: Lorena is a 21-year-old single mother who is taking care of a 4-year-old girl. Five years ago, Lorena began working in the trading business. Previously she used to helped her mother in a stationery store, then decided to start her own stationery business. She has owned her business of office supplies and gift shop for five years. Lorena is planning to buy new merchandise and supplies in order to have a more diverse line of stationery products and more options for her customers.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her stationery store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda describes herself as a woman who is always looking to generate more revenue. Aside from having a steady job, she is always looking for something else to generate income. In this case, she decided to sell clothes and shoes by catalog with her friends. Yolanda is using this loan to be able to stock herself with shoes and clothing to provide to her customers. She claims that this loan will allow her to meet the demand for the winter season.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Etelvina Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora etelbina es madre soltera de sies hijos por los cuales siempre a trabajado para sacarlos adelante ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio desde hace 20 años  de visuteria y productos avon y hace costuras en las afuera del mercadito de santa ana es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedopra  , responsable que lucha dia a dia para sacra a delante a du familia.
texts.en: Estelvina is a single mother with six children, for whom she is continually working to get them ahead. She has had a small business for the past 20 years of costume jewelry, Avon products and also she does sewing outside the small Santa Ana market. She is a hard-working, enterprising and responsible woman who struggles day by day to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy costume jewellery, Avon products.

loans.name: Sreysros

texts.en: Sreysros is 19 years old and a student at a university from Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Because of a lack of financial support, Sreysros would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her get a good education. In the future, she wants to have a good job and a new house.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Juana Isidra

texts.es: La señora juana es habitante de chinandega ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio de frutas y verduras desde hace 21 años en el mercado central  la señora tiene 5 hijos de los cuales no tiene a ninguno a su cargo ella es una mujer trabajadora ,responsable  que trabaja fuertemente para mantener su casa. y solicita el financiamiento para compra de mercaderia.
texts.en: Juana lives in the community of Tonala, in Chinandega municipality. She has had a small business of fruits and vegetables for the past 21 years in the central market. She has 5 children, of whom none are in her care. She is a hard-working, responsible woman who works hard to maintain her household. She is asking for additional financing to help her buy merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials, zinc, nails and wood.

loans.name: Shaba Group

texts.en:
Janeth is in her early thirties. She is married and has two kids, a boy and a girl, who are at school. For three and one-half years, Janeth has been supporting her family by running a grocery, selling soft drinks, beer, and spirits. She has a kitchen (JIKO) at the same business place, serving roasted meat, chips, etc. She opens the business from 03:00pm until midnight, each working day. She is able to make a good profit, each month. Janeth is able to sell more than five crates of drinks per business day.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her third credit request. The loan will be apportioned between the members of Shaba, a two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Janeth has managed to repay her previous credits, successfully. Janeth used these loans to buy business chairs and drinks. She earned an extra profit, which she used to cover part of the school fees and household expenses. In the coming years, Janeth would like to manage a big grocery with high sales.

She will invest a portion of her new loan to buy drinks, and rebuild her business to be large, together with serving food like more roasted meat.

loans.use: to buy drinks and rebuild her business to be large, together with serving food like more roasted meat.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy, a youthful 20-year-old mother, is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret, which in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Mercy is happily married and is blessed with one lovely child. 

For the past five years, she has been involved in mixed farming and she grows maize and vegetables. She also has dairy cows. Mercy has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with a challenge of delivering the produce to the market in a timely manner. This challenge has not made her give up and she states, “I have to do something for my family.“ 

Mercy joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like Mercy. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy a motorbike. Mercy is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (e.g., milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Mercy to achieve her dream and reach her goals. 

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Mercy feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva, that help women to gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Mercy will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. Her income will increase. 

Mercy is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Mercy will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her child of uninterrupted education and a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lime and wholesale corn

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rustico con su conviviente tiene 04 hijos de 17, 15, 14 y 05 años de edad los cuales se encuentran bajo su poder. Elva vive en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú; contando con servicios de agua y luz. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad que realiza Elva es la venta de articulos de primera necesidad con una antigüedad del negocio de 5 años, esta actividad la realiza en el mercado cuya actividad le genera ingresos para su subsistencia. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de productos para un negocio con ello generar mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios y buenas ganacia
texts.en:
Elva is 41-years old. She is married and lives in her own home, which is made of rustic materials, with her husband. She has four children who are 17-, 15-, 14- and 5-years old respectively, all of whom live with her. Elva lives in the Pucará DIsrict of Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region in Perú's northern mountains. They have water and electricity in their home. The people in her community make their livings primarily in agriculture, in trade and by raising livestock.

Elva's business is selling basic necessities. Her business is five years old. She has it set up in the market, and it generates income for her survival.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of products for her business. This will generate a greater income for Elva and improve her quality of life. In this line of work, there isn't much competition in the area, and Elva gets good prices and earns a good profit.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of products for her business, which will generate a better income for her and therefore improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.en: Jose Alfredo is 34 years old, has three kids and is separated from his wife. Only one of his kids is living with Alfredo. They are living with other relatives and sharing expenses of the home. For more than 22 years Alfredo has been involved in the butchery business by helping his father. In more recent years he has owned his own butchery where he also sells tacos made from his own products. The business is going well so he has decided to use this loan to buy new equipment, mainly tables, chairs and a new butcher showcase. He expects to increase the number of sales with this new investment.

loans.use: to buy new equipment, mainly tables, chairs and a new butcher showcase

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is married and blessed with four children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Salim cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru:
Лола очень трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 45 лет. У неё нет высшего образования. Замужем, но своих детей у Лолы нет. Лола сама живет со своим мужем в городе. Она одновременно и работает и учится. 
Чтобы оплатить свою учебу Лола обратилась в МДО Арванд за помощью. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Lola is a very hardworking and happy 45-year-old woman.  She doesn't have a higher education.  She is married, with no children.  She lives with her husband in Dushanbe.  She is working and studying at the same time.  She has turned to MDO Arvand in order to pay her tuition fees.  She thanks them in advance for their support and she is looking forward to a positive outcome.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Asosyasyon Fanm Peyizan Pou Devlopman Ranp Solda (

texts.en:
Women Association of Farmers for the Devlopment of Rampe Soldat, called in Creole Asosyasyon Fanm Peyizan pou Devlopman Ranp Solda (AFPDR), is the pioneer of women's associations in Ranp Solda, helping women increase their potential and promote their rights. Its mission is to participate in the development of Rampe Soldat by encouraging women to take part in economic and social activities in Haiti. 

The people in the photo are members of the coordination. They have 7 members, a coordinator, a treasurer, a secretary, two delegates, and two advisors. At the time, one was not present due to illness.

The first activity of the organization was to support children after school. Since its foundation, it has been managed by Ms. Marie Rene André. She is a woman in the community of Rampe Soldat who contributes to many projects. Since 2001, she’s been helping people in order to alleviate the conditions of life. 

The Zafen loan will allow the organization to buy peanut seeds, and beans to store in order to enhance its agriculture program. This will contribute to the sustainability of economic activity of the organization and farmers will seize the opportunity to reinforce the organizational structure of AFPDR by creating jobs.

loans.use: To buy beans, peanuts, and stocks of pesticides.

borrowers.first_name: Asosyasyon Fanm Peyizan Pou Devlopman Ranp Solda (

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos, y reside en una aldea del municipio de San Juan, Lempira. Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos de maíz y frijol y hace 12 años que decidió cultivar café. La producción de café la saca en grano en oro y lo vende en el mercado local. Con el fin de aumentar la producción ha solicitado un préstamo por 18,000 Lempiras para cubrir los gastos de siembra de una manzana mas de finca de café. Su meta es que sus hijos terminen los estudios y dejarles una fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Francisco is 36 years old, he's married and he has 2 children. He lives in a town in the municipality of San Juan, Lempira. Since he was very small he has made a living cultivating basic foodstuffs like corn and beans and 12 years ago he decided to grow coffee. He produces parchment coffee which he sells at a local market. 

In order to increase his production, he has requested a loan of 18,000 Lempiras to cover the costs of planting another manzana [1.72 acres] of coffee fields. His goal is for his children to finish their studies and to leave them a source of work.

loans.use: to cover the costs of planting another manzana of coffee fields.

loans.name: Association Des Cultivateurs Colare Mirebalais (Ac

texts.en: In 2009, a group of people had met to discuss community issues and how to resolve peasant’s problem. Many ideas come and suddenly they decided to launch an association which they call Association des Cultivateurs Colare Mirebalais (ACCM). The first activity was to organize a gala at the end of the year. After that, they fixed a section of roads, soil conservation project, built an elementary school, home garden, and kits. Mr. Bahurel Médé is the first person who took the initiative to launch it, and Mr. Jocelyn Bélony became the first coordinator through his experience in organizational’ structure. To achieve its mission, they implemented various projects such as agriculture, social, and economic. The purpose of this loan is to allow the business to answer its demands by purchasing a large quantity of seeds such as rice, bean, and corn to increase its storage. Farmers will have an opportunity to buy seeds during scarcity period where prices have a tendency to be high. This will contribute in the development of the agriculture program, and will also create jobs in order to change the life of people in Colare.

loans.use: to purchase beans, corn and rice to allow the business to meet its demands.

loans.name: Duvana

texts.en: Duvana is a passionate woman who loves cooking. She is married and began her carrier in Hotel. Despite her job, Ms. Duvana was particularly interested in food, tastes and flavors and still had the desire to create her own business. In 2010, to improve her knowledge in the kitchen, she took cooking class; she was quickly put into practicing their knowledge and began with the first product a "cocktail." This allowed people to try her products and believed in her endeavors. In 2011, she officially launched Ideal Production and developed a range of products. Then, in 2012, to consolidate her business, she followed training in Entrepreneurship in "Etre Ayisyen Foundation” which allows her to structure its activities. Since that day, the business has been running in Lascahobas. In fact, Duvana invested her time and money in social project through an organization she has launched in 2012 that they called Collective Women for the Development of Lascahobas. They produce Chanmchanm, Cremas, Alcohol, Vinegar, Tablet, Maggi powder, Cassava flour, coco grid, Popcorn, and Liqueur. The loan will allow the business to purchase raw material and equipment to build a showcasing shelf to expose their products in order to increase its capacity of production, and also create more jobs.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and raw materials in order to reinforce the business and create new jobs.

loans.name: Kibiryo

texts.ru: Кибирё 55 летняя жительница района Шахритус. Она жена и мать двоих детей. Ее муж, как и многие жители Таджикистана находиться на заработках в Российской Федерации. Кибирё живет с детьми одна. Она решила начать собственный бизнес. Она будет заниматься продажей одежды. Кибирё планирует покупать товар с рынка города Душанбе и будет перепродавать на рынке района Шахритус. Кибирё уверена в своем успехе и надеется, что ей обязательно помогут и она начнет бизнес. Кибирё нашла точку продажи, арендовала его, но на привозку и приобретения товара ей не хватает денег, по этой причине она очень хочет получить кредит.
texts.en: Kibiryo is 55 years old and she lives in the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan.  She is married and the mother of two children.  Like many Tajik men, her husband is currently working in Russia.  Kibiryo lives alone with her children, and she has decided to start her own business.  She plans to start selling clothes.  She will be buying merchandise at the market in Dushanbe, and will resell her goods at the market in Shahrituz.  Kibiryo is confident that things will work out, and she hopes to receive some support so that she can start her business.  She has already found and rented a retail outlet.  However, she doesn't have enough money to purchase and bring merchandise, which is the reason why she really wants to receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy and bring some clothes for resale.

loans.name: Carolina Yasmin
